This command works only on animation sources with "door" controller. Door_L in the example below can be animated with animateDoor but not CargoRamp_Open: heli animateDoor ["Door_L", 1];

BIS_fnc_moduleHint.description: /* Description: Show a hint to all players of side Parameter(s): http://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Modules Returns: NONE */ // Parameters

lightnings.example: Get the current lightnings value:_lightningsVal = lightnings;

removeAllCuratorAddons.description: Restrict access to all addons for given curator.

BIS_fnc_getVirtualItemCargo.description: Get virtual items from an object (e.g., ammo box). Virtual items can be selected in the Arsenal.

BIS_fnc_spawnObjects.syntax: [position, className, count, offsetMatrix, offsetDir, dirNoise, enableSimulation] call BIS_fnc_spawnObjects
BIS_fnc_spawnObjects.description: Create a stack of objects at given position or on top of given object (eg. table).

BIS_fnc_typeText2.example:
[ [ ["CAMP ROGAIN,","align = 'center' shadow = '1' size = '0.7' font='PuristaBold'"], ["RESSUPLY POINT","align = 'center' shadow = '1' size = '0.7'","#aaaaaa"], ["","
"], ["10 MINUTES LATER ...","align = 'center' shadow = '1' size = '1.0'"] ] ] spawn BIS_fnc_typeText2;
BIS_fnc_typeText2.syntax: [stringLines, posX, posY, alignBottom, rootFormat, abortParams, abortCond, playSounds] call BIS_fnc_typeText2
BIS_fnc_typeText2.description: Types a structured text on the screen, letter by letter, cursor blinking.

BIS_fnc_sortAlphabetically.description: Alphabetically sort an array of strings without modifying the original. See also sort.

BIS_fnc_filterString.description: Removes characters from a string based on the list of allowed characters.

configSourceMod.description: Returns modDir of the mod that given config class was loaded from.

BIS_fnc_removeVirtualItemCargo.description: Remove virtual items from an object (e.g., ammo box). Virtual items can be selected in the Arsenal.

BIS_fnc_curatorRespawn.description: Restore unit for curators after respawn. When curator owner, it will transfer ownership to the new unit. When editable by curator, it will remove the dead unit and register the new one.

setDynamicSimulationDistanceCoef.description: Sets activation distance multiplier of Arma_3_Dynamic_Simulation for the given class

BIS_fnc_addStackedEventHandler.description: Stacks an event handler. All event handlers accept user arguments, which are passed to the EH code in _this variable. If the EH has own params returned in _this variable as well, user arguments are appended to the end of _this array. Note that if you try to add empty EH, i.e. with empty code, it will simply be ignored.

setCenterOfMass.description: Changes the center of mass of an object smoothly during the given time (in seconds). A time of zero (or using the alternative syntax) means an immediate change.

BIS_fnc_holdKey.example: [findDisplay 46,36,5, {hint "Key 'J' pressed for 5 seconds"}] call BIS_fnc_holdKey; // Action is added to the mission display
BIS_fnc_holdKey.syntax: [display, key, time, code, control] call BIS_fnc_holdKey
BIS_fnc_holdKey.description: Function that executes a user-defined code when a key has been held down for a long enough time.

BIS_fnc_holdActionRemove.description: Removes a hold action. If the removed hold actions was the last one, disable the scripted framework.

vectorDiff.example: hint str (velocity car vectorDiff velocity bike);
vectorDiff.description: Subtracts one 3D vector from another. (vector1 - vector2)

sideAmbientLife.description: Returns side of ambient life, for example ambient life placed in Eden Editor.

isUAVConnected.description: Returns true if UAV is connected to some terminal.

BIS_fnc_returnChildren.description: Returns all subclasses within given class.

weaponCargo.description: Get array with weapons from ammo box (or any general weapon holder container).

tvAdd.description: Adds an item with given text to Tree View control. The position on Tree View where to add the item and the actual path to this item once added are different. If item is added to existing item, then parent item path is used. If no parent exists, empty array [] is used. See Tree View Path for more information.

BIS_fnc_animalBehaviour.description: Animal behaviour control. Called by Animals_F\Data\Scripts\main.fsm.

BIS_fnc_ORBATSetGroupParams.syntax: [IDType, size, type, side, name, shortName, texture, textSizeCoef, insignia, textColour, commName, commRank, description, assets] call BIS_fnc_ORBATSetGroupParams
BIS_fnc_ORBATSetGroupParams.description: Overrides group params from CfgORBAT. See ORBAT Viewer for a detailed explaination.

isPipEnabled.description: Returns true if Picture in Picture (Render to Texture) is enabled.

setCompassOscillation.example: Set compass to oscillate every second within -90/+90 degrees: setCompassOscillation [rad 90, 1, 1];
setCompassOscillation.description: This command sets random heading on the player's compass (both, in map and in 3D view) with given frequency, which is also randomised. To reset the compass back to defaults, execute: setCompassOscillation [-1, 0, 0];.

doArtilleryFire.description: Orders a unit to reload defined magazine commence fire burst on the given position (silently).

magazinesAmmoFull.description: Returns array of arrays of all vehicle's magazines with extended information about them. Magazine type is available for loaded magazines only, otherwise it is -1.

addItemToBackpack.description: Create new item and store it to soldier's backpack. The item can also be a weapon or a magazine.

ctrlSetFontHeightSecondary.description: Sets the font size of the secondary text of given control.

setVehicleCargo.example: Blackfish with no vehicle cargo loaded _success = blackfish setVehicleCargo offroad; //true
setVehicleCargo.description: Load cargo vehicle inside vehicle if possible, returns bool based on whether the vehicle was able to be loaded. Can also be used to unload a specific loaded vehicle or all loaded vehicles.

handgunItems.description: Returns array with all items assigned to the handgun. This command is used for infantry weapons only.

BIS_fnc_showRespawnMenuDisableItem.example: ["disable",uiNamespace getVariable "BIS_RscRespawnControlsMap_ctrlRoleList",2,"Restricted for this part of mission!"] call BIS_fnc_showRespawnMenuDisableItem;
BIS_fnc_showRespawnMenuDisableItem.description: Limits respawn loadout or role for Arma 3 Respawn.

setObjectTextureGlobal.description: Set the texture of the given selection on all computers in a network session.

setParticleClass.description: Sets particle source parameters using existing particle config from CfgCloudlets class. Use setParticleParams subsequently if you need to overwrite some values.

BIS_fnc_replaceWithSimpleObject.description: Replaces object with simple object. Object must not contain any crew and must be placed on ground.

BIS_fnc_respawnTimePenalty.description: /* Description: Set or execute respawn time penalty Parameter(s): 0: CODE - penalty condition 1: NUMBER - penalty delay 2: TEXT - text displayed when penalty is in effect Returns: BOOL */

BIS_fnc_taskSetDescription.example: [ "tsk_destroyAA", [ "You should plant Satchels under those Shilkas! Good luck.", "Destroy the Shilkas", "Shilkas" ] ] call BIS_fnc_taskSetDescription;
BIS_fnc_taskSetDescription.syntax: [ taskId, [ taskDescription, taskTitle, taskMarker ] ] call BIS_fnc_taskSetDescription
BIS_fnc_taskSetDescription.description: Set a task description. For easy task manipulation, use the Arma 3 Task Framework.

taskCustomData.description: Returns custom data attached to the local task or an empty array if there are no custom data attached.

BIS_fnc_curatorObjectRegistered.description: Register "curatorObjectRegistered" handler. Cost of vehicles with crews will be automatically calculated based on vehicle + crew cost.

BIS_fnc_getUnitByUid.description: Returns object belonging to given player UID

getAnimAimPrecision.description: Returns aim precision for current animation

BIS_fnc_curatorObjectEdited.description: Code executed when curator object is edited (i.e., moved or rotated). When a soldier or a vehicle is moved high above ground, create a parachute for them.

unitAddons.description: Returns list with addons the unit belongs to.

allVariables.description: Returns a list of all variables from desired namespace. Namespaces supported:

ctrlParentControlsGroup.description: Returns the parent control of a given child control

ctrlAnimationPhaseModel.description: Returns current animation phase of given source. Similar to animationSourcePhase.

sendAUMessage.description: Send the command to the list of clients.

ctAddRow.description: Adds one row of controls according to the RowTemplate class. It returns an array containing row index and array of created controls in a format [<rowIndex>, [<control0>, <control1>...<control n>]].

deleteAt.description: Removes array element at the given index and returns removed element (modifies the original array, just like resize or set). Will not issue error when -1 index is passed making it ideal for using with find(see Example 2) or findIf(see Example 3) command

getMissionDLCs.description: Returns list of DLCs that are used in the mission. List is created only from units listed in mission.sqm and doesn't detect units created by scripts!

BIS_fnc_getCfgIsClass.description: Return true if it's a class. Can by called in two ways:

BIS_fnc_allSynchronizedObjects.description: Return all synchronized objects, including those synced to synced and so on.

BIS_fnc_execRemote.description: This function is now an alias to BIS_fnc_MP. Use remoteExec and remoteExecCall instead!

roleDescription.description: Returns unit description set in Editor and visible on role selection screen in MP. Works in MP and SP.

listRemoteTargets.description: Return list of datalink targets and time for which they will be/were known

sort.description: Attempts to sort given array either in ascending (true) or descending (false) order. All array elements should be one of the following types:

tvSetPictureRight.description: Sets right picture on the tree view item defined by path

BIS_fnc_establishingShot.example: [player, "I can see my house from here", 500, 250, 75, 1, [], 0, true] spawn BIS_fnc_establishingShot
BIS_fnc_establishingShot.syntax: [target, text, altitude, radius, angle, rotation, iconOptions, mode, fadeIn,waitTime] spawn BIS_fnc_establishingShot
BIS_fnc_establishingShot.description: Play a fake UAV observational sequence which serves as an establishing shot.

BIS_fnc_VRSpawnSelector.description: Spawns the course selector (used primarily for VR missions).

all3DENEntities.description: Returns an array of all currently placed Eden Editor entities, including groups, waypoints, and markers in following format:

isLightOn.description: Returns true if vehicle headlights are on otherwise false.

animationSourcePhase.description: Returns current animation phase of given source. Similar to animationPhase or doorPhase but designed to complement animateSource. This command could be used to obtain relative turret direction and gun elevation on a vehicle (see Example 2)

BIS_fnc_createLogRecord.example: [player, "Title", "This is a log entry. Have fun!"] call BIS_fnc_createLogRecord;
BIS_fnc_createLogRecord.description: Create a dated, timed diary record in the owner's "Log" subject.

tvSetPictureRightColorDisabled.description: Sets the color of the right picture of a tree item defined by path when item is disabled

BIS_fnc_StrategicMapOpen.example: [ findDisplay 46, [2000,2000,0], [ [ [2000,2000,0], {systemChat format ["%1",name ((_this # 9) # 0)]}, "1st Mission", "This is mission one", "Name of mission's player", "\A3\Data_F_Exp\Logos\arma3_exp_icon_ca.paa", 1.5, [ player ] ], [ [1000,1000,0], {systemChat format ["%1",name ((_this # 9) # 0)]}, "2nd Mission", "This is mission two", "Name of mission's player", "\A3\Data_F_Argo\Logos\arma3_argo_logoTitle_ca.paa", 1.5, [ player ] ] ], [ [ [3000,3000,0], configFile >> "CfgORBAT" >> "BIS" >> "B_1_A_1_2", configFile >> "CfgORBAT" >> "BIS" >> "B_1", [], 10 ] ], [ "marker_1", "marker_2" ], [ [ "\A3\Ui_f\data\Logos\arma3_white_ca.paa", [0,0,0,1], [4000,4000,0], 8, 8, 0, "Arma 3 Logo", true ] ], 0, false, 1, true, "Strategic Map Example", false, "\A3\Ui_f\data\Logos\arma3_white_ca.paa" ] call BIS_fnc_StrategicMapOpen;

BIS_fnc_addVirtualBackpackCargo.description: Add virtual backpacks to an object (e.g., ammo box). Virtual items can be selected in the Arsenal.

addCuratorEditingArea.description: Adds or changes curator edit area (depends on if ID is already used).

diag_resetShapes.description: Reload models on-the-fly without the need of restarting the game. Changes applied by diag_resetShapes are applied to all new entities so restart of mission is not necessarily required - spawning vehicle again or changing back forth weapon should usually do the trick. It works only with "-FilePatching" in combination with local data. Command will reload only models present in local data.

ctHeaderControls.description: Returns array of controls on the header with the given index.

getEnvSoundController.description: Returns value of the specified controller.

linearConversion.syntax: linearConversion [minFrom, maxFrom, value, minTo, maxTo, clip]
linearConversion.description: Converts given value from given "from" range to wanted "to" range. If clipping is set to true, the resulting value is guaranteed to be within "to" range no matter what.

setDebriefingText.example: _currentObjective = (taskDescription (currentTask player)) select 2; "endDeath" setDebriefingText ["You Lose","All of your men were killed while assaulting the " + _currentObjective];
setDebriefingText.description: Sets debriefing text for endType defined in CfgDebriefing.

BIS_fnc_playEndMusic.description: Play mission end music (when it's nearing the end)

setSimulWeatherLayers.description: Sets number of simul weather layers, affects quality of simul weather clouds.

isWeaponDeployed.description: Returns true if weapon is currently deployed.

BIS_fnc_sideType.description: Returns side type based on side ID. See BIS_fnc_sideID for more information.

canAddItemToUniform.example: _item = "HandGrenade"; _fits = player canAddItemToUniform _item; if (_fits) then { player addItemToUniform _item; } else { hint "no room!"; };
canAddItemToUniform.description: Checks if given object can be stored into soldier's uniform.

uniformMagazines.description: Get array with all magazines from uniform of the given unit.

ropeCreate.syntax: ropeCreate [fromObject, fromPoint, toObject, toPoint, segments, length]
ropeCreate.description: Create a rope (PhysX rope in Arma 3).

isCopilotEnabled.example: if (!isCopilotEnabled myHeli) then { myHeli enableCopilot true; };
isCopilotEnabled.description: Returns true if copilots actions are enabled.

lbSetTooltip.description: Sets tooltip for item with given index of the listbox or combobox with id idc of the topmost user dialog to the given data.

ctData.description: Returns metadata (string) associated with a particular row of RscControlsTable.

ctRemoveHeaders.description: Takes array of header indices as a parameter and removes headers with those indices. Indices of remaining headers will be recomputed.

roadAt.description: Returns road segment at given position, objNull otherwise. Same as isOnRoad only returns the actual road object instead of boolean.

allMines.description: Returns an array of all mines in the mission

setUserMFDText.description: Stored user text value in MFD, limit is 50, user0...user49

stance.description: Returns the stance of the given unit. It can be one of:

getCameraViewDirection.example: Draw AI eye direction (green), weapon direction (red) and camera direction (blue) in 3D: bob = createGroup east createUnit ["O_Soldier_F", [0,0,0], [], 0, "NONE"]; bob setVehiclePosition [player modelToWorld [0,100,0], [], 0, "NONE"]; onEachFrame { _beg = ASLToAGL eyePos bob; _endE = (_beg vectorAdd (eyeDirection bob vectorMultiply 100)); drawLine3D [ _beg, _endE, [0,1,0,1]]; _endW = (_beg vectorAdd (bob weaponDirection currentWeapon bob vectorMultiply 100)); drawLine3D [_beg, _endW, [1,0,0,1]]; _endV = (_beg vectorAdd (getCameraViewDirection bob vectorMultiply 100)); drawLine3D [_beg, _endV, [0,0,1,1]]; };
getCameraViewDirection.description: Returns the direction unit is looking in render time scope. While for AI the origin for the view direction vector can be taken from eyePos unit, for human player the origin should be taken from player camera position positionCameraToWorld [0,0,0]

getHit.description: Returns selection damage. Same as getHitPointDamage only argument is selection part instead of hit point. Note: Some part names are in Czech; see translation table.

leaderboardInit.description: Initialize the leaderboard structure for board with given name. Returns true if board is already initialized.

BIS_fnc_dirtEffect.description: Screen dirt (texture) postprocess. Displays dust PP according to damage obtained from near explosion; takes array from "Explosion" event handler.

tvCollapse.description: Collapses tree item pointed to by the path. IDC means id of parent Tree View.

setSuppression.description: Sets the person's suppression, from 0 to 1.

BIS_fnc_buildingPositions.description: Get all available positions within a building or structure.

BIS_fnc_isLeapYear.description: Returns true if given year is a leap year, otherwise false.

enableDynamicSimulation.description: Enables or disables Arma_3_Dynamic_Simulation for given non AI object

BIS_fnc_isDemo.description: Returns true when game version is demo.

ctCurSel.description: Returns index of the selected row. Will take only rows, but not headers into account.

BIS_fnc_ambientAnim.syntax: [unit, animationset, equipmentlevel, snaptoObject, interpolate] call BIS_fnc_ambientAnim
BIS_fnc_ambientAnim.description: Play set of ambient animations on given unit.

tvText.description: Returns shown text in the item on given path. IDC means id of parent Tree View.

BIS_fnc_diagLoop.description: Runs scripted loop. Repeated call terminates previous loops.

ctClear.description: Removes all the lines from the RscControlsTable. Returns Nothing.

queryItemsPool.description: Returns the number of items of type in the weapon pool (used in campaigns to transfer weapons to the next mission).

BIS_fnc_missionTimeLeft.description: Returns time in seconds until the mission end. Remaining time can be set using estimatedTimeLeft command or using BIS_fnc_countdown.

vectorModelToWorld.example: Convert model space vector [0,-10,4] to world space; vector gets rotated according to _airplane: _airplane vectorModelToWorld [0,-10,4];
vectorModelToWorld.description: Converts vector direction from model to world space.

vectorUpVisual.description: Return object's up vector in world Position coordinates ( [x, y, z] ) in render time scope.

isUAVConnectable.description: Returns true if UAV is connectable by AV terminal(s).

BIS_fnc_basicBackpack.example: baseBackpack = "b_assaultpack_rgr_medic" call BIS_fnc_basicBackpack; // Returns "b_assaultpack_rgr", the base class.
BIS_fnc_basicBackpack.description: Determines basic backpack with no equipment present (ie empty).

getCursorObjectParams.description: Returns object and named selections under cursor and distance to object's surface (to the point cursor points at). If object surface is further away than 50 meters, selections are always an empty array and distance is 1e10 (10^10).

params.example: [1, 2, 3] call { private ["_one", "_two", "_three"]; _one = _this select 0; _two = _this select 1; _three = _this select 2; // ..... }; // Same as above, only using params [1, 2, 3] call { params ["_one", "_two", "_three"]; // ..... };
params.description: Parses input argument into array of private variables. When used without argument, as shown in main syntax, internal variable _this, which is usually available inside functions and event handlers, is used as argument.

addBackpackGlobal.description: Adds a backpack to a unit (even non-local)

getSoundController.description: Returns value of the given sound controller.

disableMapIndicators.example: Disable visualization of friendly and enemy units:disableMapIndicators [true,true,false,false];
disableMapIndicators.description: Command allows suppressing visualization of FRIENDLY, ENEMY, MINES and/or PING map indicators from difficulty setting EXTENDED MAP CONTENT.

vehicleReportRemoteTargets.description: Gets whether the vehicle shares acquired targets via datalink with the Side center.

ropeLength.description: Return rope length in meters (set by ropeCreate, ropeCut, ropeUnwind)

BIS_fnc_getCloudletParams.description: Return particle params of CfgCloudlets class.

BIS_fnc_relScaledDist.description: Exponentially inflated rational number between 0 and 1, with 1 being center and 0 being edge of the trigger. This function can be used to check where in a trigger area an object is. Is it near the border of the trigger area the number will go against 0.

BIS_fnc_incapacitatedEffect.description: A draft of incapacitated effects function.

addCuratorPoints.description: Adds or removes curator points. Points can be only in range from 0 to 1.

deleteRange.description: Removes a range of array elements from the given array (modifies the original array, just like resize or set).

setSystemOfUnits.description: Set system of units. This will only impact gauges from advanced flight model.

canSuspend.example: onEachFrame { systemChat str canSuspend; //false [] spawn {hint str canSuspend}; //true onEachFrame {}; };
canSuspend.description: Returns true if sleep, uiSleep or waitUntil commands can be used in current scope. Usually when suspension is not allowed but used, for example when code is executed in unscheduled environment, the script engine would ignore any suspension command and throw error: "Suspending not allowed in this context". Using canSuspend command allows to detect the correct environment for the code.

BIS_fnc_initParams.description: Initialize mission params and create log in the diary.

setLightFlareMaxDistance.description: Sets max distance where the flare is visible.

BIS_fnc_isUnitVirtual.description: Return if unit is virtual (used for example for Zeus players).

BIS_fnc_taskSetAlwaysVisible.description: /* Description: Flags task to be or not to be always visible. Parameters: 0: STRING - task id 1: BOOL - always visible flag Returns: STRING - task id */

BIS_fnc_initModules.description: Wait until all modules using the Arma 3 Module Framework are initialized.

removeSecondaryWeaponItem.description: Removes given weapon item from the secondary weapon cargo space. This command also supports weapon magazines.

BIS_fnc_curatorSayMessage.description: Plays some radio message from CfgRadio locally.

setHitIndex.description: Set the current level of damage for a specific Hit Point (specified by its hit part index). All hit points can be obtained with getAllHitPointsDamage command.

BIS_fnc_groupVehicles.description: Returns all vehicles a group possesses, assigned vehicles can be included.

BIS_fnc_monthDays.description: Returns number of days in given month. Takes in account for leap year.

BIS_fnc_objectHeight.description: Return object height defined by it's bounding box and ev. offset/fix.

BIS_fnc_teamColor.description: Convert number to color team name or color.

turretOwner.description: Returns id of the owner of the turret. Server only. Returns 0 on non-server and SP.

ASLToAGL.description: Converts position from PositionASL to PositionAGL

particlesQuality.description: Returns current user settings for particles quality (configure->video->general->particles). 0-low, 1-normal, 2-high

addHandgunItem.description: Adds weapon item to the weapon cargo space. This is used for infantry weapons.

setHorizonParallaxCoef.description: Sets coef used to shift horizon position based on camera height (use 0 to disable shifting).

BIS_fnc_moduleRespawnVehicle.description: /* Description: Set vehicle respawn, compatible both with SP and MP. Parameter(s): 0: OBJECT - vehicle 1: NUMBER - respawn delay in seconds (default is 0) BOOL - true to remove vehicle respawn (further params are ignored), false to check if the vehicle is marked for respawn 2: NUMBER - how long until the vehicle is automatically respawned after its crew leaves it (default is -1, i.e., disabled) 3: NUMBER - number of time the vehicle can be respawned (default is -1, i.e., unlimited) 4: CODE - code executed upon respawn. Passed arguments are [<newVehicle>,<oldVehicle>]. The old vehicle is deleted only after this code is completed. 5: POSITION - type of respawn position: 0 = where it started 1 = where it was destroyed 2 = on vehicle's side respawn marker (e.g., "respawn_vehicle_west") 3 = on BLUFOR respawn marker 4 = on OPFOR respawn marker 5 = on Independent respawn marker 6 = on Civilian respawn marker 7 = on side respawn marker of unit which destroyed the vehicle 6: NUMBER - position selection type (0 = random, 1 = newest, 2 = oldest) 7: NUMBER - type of old vehicle deletion (0 = don't delete, 1 = delete, 2 = delete with an explosion effect) 8: BOOL - true to show notifcation when the vehicle is respawned Returns: BOOL */

removeBackpackGlobal.description: Removes backpack from a unit. (even non-local)

inArea.description: Checks whether given position is inside given area. The area is usually a rectangle or an ellipse defined similar to triggerArea format. Hence argument for this command could be a trigger, a marker, a location or an array in format [center, a, b, angle, isRectangle, c]. This command also supports hexagon area which can be created from ellipse when both a and b are negative. Hexagon ellipses are also supported by both marker creation and drawEllipse.

removeItemFromUniform.description: Removes item from soldier's uniform. Can be used with magazines and weapons too.

set3DENLogicType.description: Sets the new type of Logic object(s). For other objects use set3DENObjectType

vectorWorldToModelVisual.example: Convert world space vector [0,-10,4] to model space of object _airplane: _airplane vectorWorldToModelVisual [0,-10,4];
vectorWorldToModelVisual.description: Converts vector direction from world to model space in render time scope.

setLightnings.description: Changes the lightnings value smoothly during the given time (in seconds). A time of zero means there will be an immediate change.

BIS_fnc_diagPreviewCycle.description: Previews selected class from the list. When cheat1 is activated, classnames will be shown instead of display names.

addOwnedMine.description: Sets ownership over a remotely detonatable mine to the unit.

enableDiagLegend.description: Enable or disable the legend for diagnostics. Internal dev only

vehicleReceiveRemoteTargets.description: Gets whether the vehicle can acquire targets via datalink from the Side center.

ctrlSetFontSecondary.description: Sets the font size of the secondary text of given control.

shownCuratorCompass.description: Returns true if compass is shown.

getCustomAimingCoef.description: Returns aimPrecision from animation state with custom value that will directly affects weapon sway size and speed.

getMousePosition.description: Returns mouse position in UI coordinates.

enableUAVConnectability.description: Enables unit's AV terminal(s) connecting to UAV.

ropeCut.description: Cut rope and detach rope from vehicle

profileNameSteam.description: Returns name of the current Steam profile.

selectionNames.description: Returns the list of model selections

disableRemoteSensors.description: This command will halt raycasting calculations (on the local machine only) for all groups which don't contain any local entities. If a group contains a single local entity then calculations will still be performed for the entire group.

BIS_fnc_isBuildingEnterable.description: Check whether a building or structure has available positions defined within model.

getConnectedUAV.description: Returns UAV if unit has connection to some UAV.

serverName.description: Returns name of the hosting server in MP, "" in SP.

BIS_fnc_paramGuerFriendly.description: Set relationship between Independents and remaining sides.

BIS_fnc_weaponComponents.description: Returns array with classname of the parent weapon (without attachments), followed by classnames of all its attachments.

setPosWorld.description: Sets position of an object based on PositionWorld, which is PositionASL of the model centre [0,0,0].

reverse.description: Reverses given array by reference (modifies the original array, just like resize).

BIS_fnc_VRDrawBorder.description: Visualizes area border (used primarily for VR missions).

add3DENLayer.description: Add an editing layer in Eden Editor.

BIS_fnc_tridentHandleDamage.description: Register a unit as Trident unit. When competing sides are still friendly and the unit is killed by the competing side, the killer won't be punsihed by negative score. Instead, Trident relationship will decrease.

parseSimpleArray.description: Converts given, formatted as simple array, String into a valid Array. Simple array is array consisting of Numbers, Strings, Booleans and Arrays of all of the above. For example: [1,"2",true,[4,"five",false]]. The string representation of this array compatible with parseSimpleArray will be "[1,""2"",true,[4,""five"",false]]" accordingly.

setGusts.description: Changes the gusts value smoothly during the given time (in seconds). A time of zero means there will be an immediate change. Value is 0 to 1.

setFeatureType.example: Set a building to be always rendered: building setFeatureType 2;
setFeatureType.description: Enable/disable object as a feature/landmark. Possible feature types:

ctrlTextHeight.description: Returns the control text height. Supported control types are:

ctSetRowTemplate.description: Takes config path to the new row template. Clears the whole RscControlsTable and sets the new row template (Deleting all rows and headers is easier to implement than replacing the rows and filling them with new data. IDCs could overflow etc.).

BIS_fnc_diagMissionWeapons.description: Lists all weapons and magazines available in a mission.

BIS_fnc_removeVirtualBackpackCargo.description: Remove virtual backpacks from an object (e.g., ammo box). Virtual items can be selected in the Arsenal.

unassignItem.example: bluforUnit unassignItem "NVGoggles"; bluforUnit removeItem "NVGoggles"; opforUnit unassignItem "NVGoggles_OPFOR"; opforUnit removeItem "NVGoggles_OPFOR"; independentUnit unassignItem "NVGoggles_INDEP"; independentUnit removeItem "NVGoggles_INDEP";
unassignItem.description: Unassigns existing item and tries to put it into inventory. If there is no space in inventory the item simply disappears.

BIS_fnc_groupFromNetId.description: Extends MP-only groupFromNetId functionality to SP

BIS_fnc_showMissionStatus.description: Show mission status with sectors, respawn tickets, etc.

removeFromRemainsCollector.description: Removes vehicles/units from disposal manager, added earlier with addToRemainsCollector

forceWeaponFire.example: _unit forceWeaponFire ["arifle_MX_F", "Single"]; _unit forceWeaponFire ["hgun_ACPC2_F", "hgun_ACPC2_F"]; _unit forceWeaponFire ["HandGrenadeMuzzle","HandGrenadeMuzzle"]; _unit forceWeaponFire ["MiniGrenadeMuzzle","MiniGrenadeMuzzle"]; _unit forceWeaponFire ["HandGrenade_Stone","HandGrenade_Stone"]; _unit forceWeaponFire ["SmokeShellMuzzle","SmokeShellMuzzle"]; _unit forceWeaponFire ["ChemlightGreenMuzzle","ChemlightGreenMuzzle"]; _unit forceWeaponFire ["IRGrenade","IRGrenade"]; _unit forceWeaponFire ["Laserdesignator","Laserdesignator"];
forceWeaponFire.description: The unit will be forced to fire weapon from the given muzzle. The weapon will not fire if firemode passed as parameter is not supported by the given muzzle. The muzzle could belong to a vehicle weapon and unit in this case will be the unit operating this weapon. Doesnt't seem to work for units in FFV positions. Works on player. See also: BIS_fnc_fire

displayParent.description: Returns parent display of the given display.

addMagazines.description: Adds multiple magazines to the unit. For cargo containers use addMagazineCargoGlobal command.

BIS_fnc_MP.example: // Logs a message for every player on the server. ["Imma spamming your log!","BIS_fnc_log"] call BIS_fnc_MP;
BIS_fnc_MP.syntax: [params, functionName, target, isPersistent, isCall] call BIS_fnc_MP;
BIS_fnc_MP.description: Send function for remote execution (and executes locally if conditions are met).

setAmmo.example: Set player's handgun magazine ammo count to 10 rounds: player setAmmo [handgunWeapon player, 10];
setAmmo.description: Sets custom ammo count in the currently loaded magazine of the specified weapon. The unit must be local to the computer where command is executed.

BIS_fnc_diagMissionPositions.description: Displays positions of units from all missions

unitAimPosition.description: Returns the position on the unit other units can aim at. Same as aimPos only returns position in PositionAGL format and has render scope alternative unitAimPositionVisual.

curatorMouseOver.description: Returns Curator Editable Object under curator mouse pointer in form of array:

backpack.description: Returns a class of a backpack.

magazinesAmmo.description: Returns array of arrays of all vehicle's magazines and their ammo count (also works on supply boxes). When applied to a unit (soldier), the command behaves differently and will omit magazines already loaded into unit's weapons. Use magazinesAmmoFull to return all magazines.

getPlayerScores.description: In MP: returns the unit's table of scores (infantry kills, soft vehicle kills, armor kills, air kills, deaths, total score). In SP: empty array []

primaryWeaponItems.description: Returns array with all items assigned to the primary weapon. This command is used for infantry weapons only.

setRainbow.description: Changes the rainbow value smoothly during the given time (in seconds). A time of zero means there will be an immediate change.

BIS_fnc_terrainGradAngle.description: Returns the gradient angle (in radians) of the terrain at a specified position and a compass direction. It is an angle of the slope of a tangent plane to the terrain at the specified position in the specified direction.

controlsGroupCtrl.description: Returns a child control with specified idc from a controls group

removeAll3DENEventHandlers.description: Removes all Eden Editor event handlers of given type.

BIS_fnc_getCfgDataArray.description: Gets an array defined in Config. If the value is not an array, it's retyped into one.

getUserMFDText.description: Returns array of user text variables used in MFD.

BIS_fnc_didJIP.example: if ([] call BIS_fnc_didJIP) then { forceRespawn player };
BIS_fnc_didJIP.description: Return whether or not the local player joined the game while it was already in progress.

BIS_fnc_unitHeadgear.example: [this] call BIS_fnc_unitHeadgear; // headgear and face wear, same as [this, [], []]
BIS_fnc_unitHeadgear.description: Randomise headgear and facewear of a character.

hideObjectGlobal.description: This command is designed for MP. Hides object on all connected clients as well as JIP. Call on the

BIS_fnc_loadClass.description: Searches for class in mission, campaign and then in global config file.

sideEmpty.description: Returns empty side, for example static buildings in Eden Editor.

getVehicleCargo.description: Get a list of vehicles loaded as cargo inside this vehicle. The returned array is in the order the cargo vehicles were added to containing vehicle.

enableCopilot.example: if (!isCopilotEnabled myHeli) then { myHeli enableCopilot true; };

create3DENEntity.description: Create new Eden Entity. Used for creating individual entities; to create a composition (e.g., infantry squad), use create3DENComposition.

drawLine3D.description: Draws a line of a given color between two 3D positions. Command has to be executed each frame. Use onEachFrame or addMissionEventHandler "Draw3D".

leaderboardDeInit.description: Deletes internal class for the leaderboard with given name. Returns true if the board has been found and deinitialized.

getPylonMagazines.description: Return array of magazines on pylons

ctrlModelDirAndUp.description: Returns vectorDir and vectorUp of the model used in 3D Dialog Control.

lbSetPictureColorSelected.description: Sets the selected color of item's picture (left) with the given index of the listbox with id idc of the topmost user dialog to the given color. Color is in format Color. Color which consists from only zeros means disable this override.

turretLocal.description: Checks if a turret is local.

BIS_fnc_error.example: ["Player is too far away (%1)",player distance dude] call BIS_fnc_error;
BIS_fnc_error.description: Log error message and display it (bottom of the UI). If it's called from a function, it'll include the function name before your content. Output is: "profileName/log: ERROR: <your content>"

BIS_fnc_getVirtualBackpackCargo.description: Get virtual backpacks from an object (e.g., ammo box). Virtual items can be selected in the Arsenal.

BIS_fnc_removeCommMenuItem.description: Remove an item from the communication menu.

BIS_fnc_locationDescription.example: hint format ["Player's position: %1", player call BIS_fnc_locationDescription];
BIS_fnc_locationDescription.description: Return location description (e.g. "NE of Agia Marina")

ropes.description: Returns all ropes attached to a ropes owner vehicle in an Array.

BIS_fnc_healthEffects.description: Effects when player is hit. Parameters are sent by handleDamage event handler.

tvValue.description: Returns scalar data from item on given path. IDC means id of parent Tree View.

addItem.example: bluforUnit addItem "NVGoggles"; bluforUnit assignItem "NVGoggles"; opforUnit addItem "NVGoggles_OPFOR"; opforUnit assignItem "NVGoggles_OPFOR"; independentUnit addItem "NVGoggles_INDEP"; independentUnit assignItem "NVGoggles_INDEP";
addItem.description: Creates new item and tries to add it into inventory. Inventory must have enough space to accomodate new item or command will fail.The item can also be a weapon or a magazine.

BIS_fnc_showAANArticle.example: [ [ ["title","My Title"], ["meta",["Katherine Bishop",[2035,2,24,11,38],"CET"]], ["textbold","This is a bold text"], ["image",["\a3\Missions_F_Orange\Data\Img\orange_overview_ca.paa","Some image description"]], ["box",["\a3\Missions_F_Orange\Data\Img\Faction_IDAP_overview_CA.paa","You won't believe how playing Showcase Laws of War can change your life!"]], ["text","Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Morbi tincidunt pretium ultricies. Etiam ac ornare est, quis posuere nisl. Mauris facilisis lectus eu turpis maximus consequat. Donec ut metus nec risus tristique mattis. Ut posuere rutrum tellus, ut molestie orci mattis id. Cras ultrices euismod diam, in venenatis nunc commodo eget. Interdum et malesuada fames ac ante ipsum primis in faucibus. Morbi congue dolor rutrum lectus euismod, ac faucibus magna molestie. Aliquam in libero sit amet eros sagittis tristique. Nam pellentesque dignissim aliquam."], ["textlocked",["Sed non est risus. Nulla condimentum at leo sed bibendum. Phasellus laoreet sit amet leo tincidunt consequat. Curabitur nec hendrerit purus. Nam massa nisi, mattis in aliquet consectetur, ornare eget nibh. Nunc dignissim, nibh sit amet ultrices tincidunt, mi nulla fermentum quam, non condimentum dolor eros vulputate massa.","SUBSCRIBE PLZ"]], ["author",["\a3\Missions_F_Orange\Data\Img\avatar_journalist_ca.paa","Katherine Bishop is a journalist"]] ] ] call bis_fnc_showAANArticle;

setLightFlareSize.description: Sets relative size of the flare for the light.

set3DENLinesVisible.example: set3DENLinesVisible [ false, false ]; Hide all lines
set3DENLinesVisible.description: Toggle visibility of Eden Editor lines.

setLocalWindParams.description: Sets parameters for helicopter rotor wash. Visually it affects how much the grass and bushes bend under a helicopter and how big is the area of the effect. Default [1.0, 1.0].

disableNVGEquipment.description: Enables or disables transport NV (Night Vision). To disable TI (Thermal Imaging) use disableTIEquipment.

openSteamApp.description: Opens a Steam application, returns false if it wasn't possible to run the application.

pixelGridNoUIScale.description: Returns grid size based on screen resolution and configs: uiScaleFactor, uiScaleMaxGrids As mentioned in the name of this command, the user interface scale is ignored.

targets.example: _targets = _unit targets [false, 300, [east,sideEnemy]]; //all targets of east or renegade side in 300m
targets.syntax: unit targets [enemyOnly, maxDistance, sides, maxAge, alternateCenter]
targets.description: Retrives list of given unit targets matching specified filter. If the filter is not specified, all targets are returned.

addSecondaryWeaponItem.description: Adds weapon item to the weapon cargo space. This is used for infantry weapons.

getClientState.description: Returns client state in network game. Works on both, client and dedicated server. The following states are possible:

ropeDetach.description: Detach a rope from an object.

isAutonomous.description: Returns true if UAV is in autonomous mode.

BIS_fnc_ambientFlyby.example: ambFlyby = [[200,200,50],[250,250,75]] call BIS_fnc_ambientFlyBy; //Spawns a Littlebird that flies from position 200,200,50 to 250,250,75 at height 100 and Normal speed.
BIS_fnc_ambientFlyby.description: Spawns an air unit that moves from point A to point B, never engaging nor being engaged. It is set as captive and will despawn once it reaches it's destination.

setParticleFire.description: Set fire parameters to particle effect. Note: You need to create emitter at first. Basic parameters of particle effect must be defined too. You can use script commands setParticleClass or setParticleParams to do so (see example). Correspondence between CfgCloudlets class param names and command array of params: particleSource setParticleFire [ coreIntensity, coreDistance, damageTime ];

assignCurator.description: Assign player as curator. Two players cannot act as one curator.

forgetTarget.description: Resets info group has about target

removeAllAssignedItems.description: Unassigns and deletes all linked items from inventory. The commands operates on assignedItems array, which doesnt include goggles or headgear. Use removeGoggles and removeHeadgear for those.

ropeAttachTo.description: Attach vehicle to rope with optional offset

actionIDs.description: Returns Array of Numbers, where numbers are IDs of all user actions added to given entity with addAction command.

BIS_fnc_moduleFuel.description: Set fuel of linked units' vehicles.

logNetworkTerminate.description: Terminates a network log file started with logNetwork with the given handle

enableMimics.description: Enables/disables mimics on a given unit.

BIS_fnc_openFieldManual.description: Opens Field Manual in briefing (SP, MP Server, MP Client) and players's map or journal. Selects the topic and hint passed as parameters. Can apply a (search) filter if desired.

BIS_fnc_showRespawnMenu.example: ["open"] call BIS_fnc_showRespawnMenu; // spawn does work as well
BIS_fnc_showRespawnMenu.description: Triggers the respawn screen in the given mode

hasPilotCamera.description: Returns true if the object airplane or helicopter has a pilotCamera.

didJIPOwner.description: Checks if the current owner of supplied Object Joined In Progress. Server execution only. On clients returns false.

isObjectRTD.description: Returns true if RTD model is loaded

allSimpleObjects.description: Returns array of all simple objects that belong to the listed class names. If the array of types is empty [], all simple objects are returned including those without class name.

enginesTorqueRTD.description: Torque produced by engines in N·m (Newton*meter)

BIS_fnc_holdActionAdd.example: [player, "Kill", "", "", "true", "true", { hint "Started!" }, { systemChat str (_this select 3) }, { player setDamage 1 }, { hint "Afraid of death?" }, [], 10, nil, true, false] call BIS_fnc_holdActionAdd;
BIS_fnc_holdActionAdd.syntax: [target, title, idleIcon, progressIcon, conditionShow, conditionProgress, codeStart, codeProgress, codeCompleted, codeInterrupted, arguments, duration, priority, removeCompleted, showUnconscious] call BIS_fnc_holdActionAdd
BIS_fnc_holdActionAdd.description: Adds an action to an object which requires the user to hold a key to perform the action.

weaponLowered.description: True if given soldier's weapon is lowered.

getSoundControllerResult.description: Returns the calculated value of simple expression in config.

currentMagazineDetailTurret.description: Returns the class name of currently used magazine on specified turret. Use turret path [-1] for driver's turret. Note that a turret is not loaded until unit enters it, so this command will return "".

secondaryWeaponItems.description: Returns array with all items assigned to the secondary weapon. This command is used for infantry weapons only.

channelEnabled.example: _isGlobalChatEnabled = (channelEnabled 0) select 0; // Check if user can use text on global channel
channelEnabled.description: Returns true or false depending on whether the given channel is enabled or disabled. For more information about enabling/disabling of chat channels see enableChannel. Channel / Number correspondence:

BIS_fnc_getRespawnMarkers.description: Returns all respawn markers for given side.

connectTerminalToUAV.description: Connect person with UAV terminal to UAV unit. UAV Terminal item needs to be assigned to GPS slot. If UAV is already connected to another terminal, this new connection will fail.

BIS_fnc_addVirtualWeaponCargo.description: Add virtual weapons to an object (e.g., ammo box). Virtual items can be selected in the Arsenal.

BIS_fnc_initVirtualUnit.description: Initialize virtual unit. Disable it, turn the camera upwards and save its correct side.

primaryWeaponMagazine.description: Returns array containing class name of currently loaded primary weapon magazine (or magazines in case of weapon having grenade launcher), otherwise it returns []. This command is used for infantry weapons only.

BIS_fnc_diagFindMissingAuthors.description: Copies a list of objects to the clipboard which miss the author attribute.

setDynamicSimulationDistance.description: Sets activation distance of Arma_3_Dynamic_Simulation for given category

saveJoysticks.description: Saves joysticks key mappings into the joysticks.cfg file. Engine add these joysticks to the Joystick Scheme mapping dialog in options controls section.

ctValue.description: Returns metadata (number) associated with a particular row of RscControlsTable.

enginesIsOnRTD.description: Returns which engines are producing some work.

BIS_fnc_bloodEffect.example: [10] call BIS_fnc_bloodEffect; // Adds the blood effect for 10 (milli)seconds.
BIS_fnc_bloodEffect.description: Adds the bleeding effect post-processing effect to the players screen.

setPilotCameraDirection.description: Sets the direction of object airplane or helicopter pilotCamera (vector in model space).

tvSort.description: Sorts childrens of given item by item name (tvText). IDC means id of parent Tree View.

weaponAccessories.description: Get array with all items linked to a given weapon.

addCuratorAddons.description: Allow curator use of given addon.

secondaryWeaponMagazine.description: Returns either single element array, containing class name of currently loaded in the secondary weapon magazine, or an empty array if unit has no secondary weapon or secondary weapon is not loaded. This command is used for infantry weapons only.

addMusicEventHandler.description: Adds playMusic event handler. Returns id of the handler or -1 when failed. Just like addMissionEventHandler, music EH is also attached to the mission.

gusts.description: Return the current gusts value. Scale is 0 to 1.

BIS_fnc_getCfgData.description: Smart-return number, text or array value from config.

shownScoretable.description: Returns the state of the score table set with showScoretable command.

setGroupOwner.description: Changes the ownership of a group (and all its units) to a given client. Group leader can't be a player. Only works when called from a server. Returns true if locality was changed. For agents use setOwner command.

addItemCargo.description: Creates new items and stores them in given container. Works with items, weapons and magazines. For global variant see addItemCargoGlobal

removeAllContainers.description: Removes all containers from the unit.

BIS_fnc_taskExists.description: Return true if a task exists.

ctFindRowHeader.description: Takes index of a row as a parameter. Returns index of the closest header above this row.

vestContainer.description: Returns a cargo container of a unit's vest.

addWeaponTurret.description: Adds a weapon to the turret. Use turret path [-1] for driver's turret.

BIS_fnc_exportEditorPreviews.syntax: [duration, type, sides, mods, addons] spawn BIS_fnc_exportEditorPreviews
BIS_fnc_exportEditorPreviews.description: Export screeenshots of objects for Eden Editor and Community Wiki to <Arma 3 Profile>\Screenshots\EditorPreviews directory.

setUnloadInCombat.description: If cargo or turret units should get out of vehicle when in combat. If true, vehicle will stop and units will dismount. Vehicle must be local.

allowCuratorLogicIgnoreAreas.description: Allows curator placing and working with modules outside of edit areas.

lbSetPictureColorDisabled.description: Sets the disabled color of item's picture (left) with the given index of the listbox with id idc of the topmost user dialog to the given color. Color is in format Color. Color which consists from only zeros means disable this override.

removeHeadgear.description: Removes headgear from a unit. If unit has no headgear command quietly fails.

BIS_fnc_onPlayerConnected.example: [ { params ["_player", "_params"]; hint name _player; hint _params; }, "Parameter" ] call BIS_fnc_onPlayerConnected;
BIS_fnc_onPlayerConnected.description: Executes a function on server every time a player connects the mission.

BIS_fnc_moveToRespawnPosition.description: Move given unit to given respawn position. Units moved to height >= 30m will start on parachute. Position [0,0,0] is blacklisted. This function must be executed where unit to be moved is local

get3DENIconsVisible.example: if (get3DENIconsVisible select 0) then {hint "Icons are visible in the map.";};
get3DENIconsVisible.description: Get visibility state of Eden Editor icons.

canAddItemToBackpack.example: _item = "HandGrenade"; _fits = player canAddItemToBackpack _item; if (_fits) then { player addItemToBackpack _item; } else { hint "no room!"; };
canAddItemToBackpack.description: Checks if given object can be stored into soldier's backpack.

addItemToUniform.description: Create new item and store it to soldier's uniform. The item can also be a weapon or a magazine.

setVehicleRadar.description: Sets the AI rules of Radar usage (Emission Control). Automatic means Radar switched on only when in Combat. The command doesn't affect player-controlled vehicles.

BIS_fnc_liveFeedSetTarget.description: Set the target of the current live feed.

groupOwner.description: Returns ID of client to which the group is local. Can be run only from server. When called from client, it always returns 0

setPilotCameraRotation.description: Sets rotation (relative to the centered camera position) of the object airplane or helicopter pilotCamera .

BIS_fnc_titlecard.description: Display a mission-specific titlecard before the mission begins. Only works the first time it's called.

setWindForce.description: Set max. wind overall wind changes in time. A time of zero means there will be an immediate change. A wind level of zero is minimal changes and a wind level of one means that wind can change rapidly.

BIS_fnc_setTask.syntax: [taskId, target, description, (destination, state, priority, showNotification, isGlobal, type, visibleIn3D)] call BIS_fnc_setTask;

openYoutubeVideo.description: Opens Steam overlay with given YT video. Video URL is the end part of the YT URL, starting with watch?v=.... If the user has Steam overlay disabled, the command will display appropriate message to the user and return false.

getBleedingRemaining.description: Returns how many seconds injured unit will continue leaving blood trail. If unit damage is < 0.1, the return value is 0 and unit doesn't leave any blood trail. Use setBleedingRemaining to set different remaining time.

loadUniform.description: Returns current sum of mass from items stored in a uniform.

getRelPos.example: Find position 100 metres away at player's 3 o'clock:_relpos = player getRelPos [100, 90];
getRelPos.description: Returns position, which is given distance and relative direction away from original object.

BIS_fnc_removeAllScriptedEventHandlers.description: Removes all scripted event handler with given name. Additionally "ScriptedEventHandlerRemoved" scripted EH is called for every removed event handler. For the list of available scripted event handlers see Arma 3: Event Handlers/ScriptedEventHandlers

BIS_fnc_addScriptedEventHandler.description: Adds scripted event handler and returns its id. Additionally "ScriptedEventHandlerAdded" scripted EH is called. For the list of available scripted event handlers see Arma 3: Event Handlers/ScriptedEventHandlers

setUserMFDvalue.example: BIS_Plane setUserMFDvalue [0,1]; // user0 in MFD will return 1
setUserMFDvalue.description: When MFD is using user controllers, this command can set values on them. For example, MFD config for Blackfoot has an entry

BIS_fnc_moduleEffectsSmoke.description: Creates smoke on position of module (called usually by BIS_fnc_moduleEffectsEmitterCreator).

useAISteeringComponent.description: Enable the new AI driving, used to test the old and new AI driving.

getPosASLW.description: Returns the object position height above sea surface (waves included).

loadVest.description: Returns current sum of mass from items stored in a vest.

BIS_fnc_formatCuratorChallengeObjects.description: Format the list of objects compatible with curator challenge to be displayed in the task descriptipon.

setWindStr.example: 60 setWindStr 0.8; // set the wind strength to 0.8 gradually over the next 60 seconds
setWindStr.description: Changes the wind strength smoothly during the given time (in seconds). A time of zero means there will be an immediate change.

BIS_fnc_loadEntry.description: Searches for config entry in mission, campaign and then in global config file.

tvSetTooltip.description: Sets the tooltip text associated with the specified tree view path.

BIS_fnc_activateAddons.description: Activate addons upon mission start. Doesn't work when the mission is already running.

ctrlHTMLLoaded.example: _control htmlLoad "test.html"; if (!ctrlHTMLLoaded _control) then { hint "Loading test.html failed!"; };
ctrlHTMLLoaded.description: Returns true when HTML content was successfully loaded.

playSound3D.syntax: playSound3D [filename, soundSource, isInside, soundPosition, volume, soundPitch, distance]
playSound3D.description: Plays positional sound with given filename on every computer on network. At least 2 parameters must be specified.

tvSetPictureColorSelected.description: Sets the color of the left picture of a tree item defined by path when item is selected

visibleGPS.description: Checks if the player has GPS receiver opened and visible

removeAllPrimaryWeaponItems.description: Removes all items from weapon except magazine.

getCompatiblePylonMagazines.example: vehicle player getCompatiblePylonMagazines 0; // returns array of arrays containing all compatible magazines
getCompatiblePylonMagazines.description: Get array of compatible pylon magazines

BIS_fnc_getVirtualMagazineCargo.description: Get virtual magazines from an object (e.g., ammo box). Virtual items can be selected in the Arsenal.

BIS_fnc_diagWiki.description: Scans specific config folder and outputs the values in wiki format.

BIS_fnc_ctrlSetScale.description: Scale a control while maintaining its centering.

isDLCAvailable.description: Returns true if the DLC is marked as available. (Steam)

BIS_fnc_changeSupportRadioChannel.description: /* Description: Changes the radio channel for Support module-related protocol. Parameter(s): _this select 0: SIDE - Affected side _this select 1: ANY - Channel setting Returns: nothing */

ctrlAngle.description: Gets rotation info of an ST_PICTURE control.

lineIntersectsObjs.example: Sto = []; Fn = { { Sto set [_foreachindex,lineIntersectsObjs [(eyePos player),(ATLtoASL screenToWorld [0.5,0.5]),objNull,objNull,false,_x]]; } forEach [1,2,4,8,16,32]; hintSilent format [" ONLY_WATER: %1, NEAREST_CONTACT: %2, ONLY_STATIC: %3, ONLY_DYNAMIC: %4, FIRST_CONTACT: %5, ALL_OBJECTS: %6", Sto select 0,Sto select 1,Sto select 2,Sto select 3,Sto select 4,Sto select 5]; }; ["sample_id","onEachFrame","Fn"] call BIS_fnc_addStackedEventHandler; //Example display objects' array in the middle of the screen sorted by 6 flags
lineIntersectsObjs.syntax: lineIntersectsObjs [begPos, endPos, withObj, ignoreObj, sortByDistance, flags]
lineIntersectsObjs.description: Returns list of objects intersected by given line from begPos to endPos.

BIS_fnc_VREffectKilled.description: Delete body of a virtual soldier after he's killed.

BIS_fnc_addCommMenuItem.example: _supportHeli = [player,"Support_Request_CAS_Heli"] call BIS_fnc_addCommMenuItem; _supportHeli = [player,"Support_Request_CAS_Heli",nil,nil,""] call BIS_fnc_addCommMenuItem; // don't show notification
BIS_fnc_addCommMenuItem.description: Add communication menu to the given unit. The item will be available in the Communication menu and visualized in comm menu icon area.

doSuppressiveFire.description: Order the given unit to suppress a given position or target (without radio messages).

currentThrowable.description: Returns currently selected throwable, which will be launched if user presses "G".

ctrlChecked.description: Returns the current state of given checkbox in checkboxes control (CT_CHECKBOXES type 7 of Dialog Control). Since Arma 3 v1.71.141591 it is possible to query multiple checkboxes by providing checkbox index. For more information see DialogControls-CheckBoxes.

BIS_fnc_isCuratorEditable.description: Return true if given object is editable by player (when he's curator).

BIS_fnc_dynamicGroups.description: Function that adds dynamic groups to the mission as seen in End Game. Function needs to be initialized on server and client. Clients can then use action TeamSwitch ("U" by default) to access the Dynamic Groups interface.

remoteExecCall.example: // runs hint "hello" on each connected client "hello" remoteExecCall ["hint"];
remoteExecCall.description: Asks server to execute given scripted function or script command on given target PC. The environment chosen for the execution is as follows:

BIS_fnc_listCuratorPlayers.description: Returns list of playable units with access to curator.

isEqualType.description: Compares 2 values by their type. A much faster alternative to typeName a == typeName b.

leaderboardGetRows.description: Returns an array with values for the given leaderboard, the array is in format: [[player1Name, score, rank], [player2Name, score, rank], [player3Name, score, rank] ... ]; This can be called after the one of the row request function has been called and successfully finished!

BIS_fnc_liveFeedModuleSetTarget.description: /* Description: Set a live feed's target via a module. Parameters: _this: OBJECT - Live Feed - Set Target module */ // On dedicated servers, player is not you

missionDifficulty.description: Return difficulty that has been forced for this mission, returns -1 if difficulty is not forced and it's used one from player's options.

BIS_fnc_ORBATOpen.syntax: [path, display, tags, numTiers, parameters] call BIS_fnc_ORBATOpen

getObjectType.description: Returns object type as a number:

vectorCos.description: Cosine of angle between two 3D vectors.

BIS_fnc_moduleTaskSetState.description: /* Description: Set Task State module function */

setCuratorCoef.description: Sets coef for some action (coef have to be bigger than -1 000 000, anything lower is considered as disabled action).

BIS_fnc_simpleObjectData.description: Get complete data needed for simple object creation.

ctrlModel.description: Returns model used in 3D Dialog Control.

backpackItems.description: Get array with all items (of any kind, even weapons) in backpack of the given unit.

curatorPoints.description: Returns number of points that curator have. Points can be only in range from 0 to 1.

BIS_fnc_getCfgSubClasses.description: /* Description: Return all child classes of given class. Remark(s): * Can by called 2 ways: * 1st way (general) works for any config. * 2nd way is for comfortable working with mission description.ext. Parameter(s): _this: CFG _this: ARRAY of STRINGS - missionConfigFile classes and an attribute. Example: * 1st way of calling: _subclasses = (missionconfigfile >> "Hubs" >> "A1" >> "QuickStart") call Bis_fnc_getCfgSubClasses; * 2nd way of calling: _subclasses = ["Hubs"] call Bis_fnc_getCfgSubClasses; Returns: ARRAY (of STRINGS with sub-classes names) */

admin.description: This is dedicated server command, which queries the admin state of any client on the network by their client (owner) id. Possible results are:

BIS_fnc_getRespawnInventories.description: /* Description: Return respawn inventories available for the given unit Parameter(s): 0: OBJECT, GROUP, SIDE or NAMESPACE 1 (Optional): BOOL - true to show even inventories disabled by curator 2 (Optional): BOOL - true to return namespace, inventory and role limits (used in the new respawn screen) instead of inventories itself Returns: ARRAY (of Strings) */

removeItem.example: bluforUnit unassignItem "NVGoggles"; bluforUnit removeItem "NVGoggles"; opforUnit unassignItem "NVGoggles_OPFOR"; opforUnit removeItem "NVGoggles_OPFOR"; independentUnit unassignItem "NVGoggles_INDEP"; independentUnit removeItem "NVGoggles_INDEP";

removeAllMissionEventHandlers.description: Removes all mission event handlers of the given type which were added by addMissionEventHandler.

BIS_fnc_enemyDetected.description: Returns true if unit knows about nearby enemy unit or driven vehicle.

itemsWithMagazines.example: itemsWithMagazines player //is essentially the same as items player + magazines player [ "FirstAidKit", //item "30Rnd_65x39_caseless_mag", //magazine "16Rnd_9x21_Mag", //magazine "Chemlight_green", //magazine "HandGrenade", //magazine "ToolKit", //item "MineDetector" //item ]
itemsWithMagazines.description: Returns combined array including all unit's items and all unit's magazines. Loaded magazines such as currentMagazine, primaryWeaponMagazine, secondaryWeaponMagazine, handgunMagazine as well as assignedItems are excluded.

BIS_fnc_call.example: Show a message for the current player. [["Hello"], {hint (_this select 0);}] call BIS_fnc_call;
BIS_fnc_call.description: Execute given code with or without parameter.

eyeDirection.example: can = "Land_Can_V3_F" createVehicle position player; onEachFrame { can setPosASL [ (eyePos player select 0) + (eyeDirection player select 0), (eyePos player select 1) + (eyeDirection player select 1), (eyePos player select 2) + (eyeDirection player select 2) ] }
eyeDirection.description: Returns the direction object is watching (eyes, or a vehicle primary observer).

weaponsItems.description: Returns an array with subarrays contains class names and also names of connected items of all the vehicle's weapons.

BIS_fnc_exportCfgVehicles.description: Export list of objects for Community Wiki (Assets).

BIS_fnc_diagMacrosMapSize.description: /* Description: Prints mapSize values based on real object size and copies it to clipboard. Mission has to be running on order to get the values. Parameter(s): 0: CONFIG or ARRAY - either config container, or list of classes or classnames 1: STRING - output mode, can be on of following: "wiki" - wiki table "config" - #define macros with model dimension values "config_current" - #define macros with current config values 2: ARRAY - list of classnames which will be excluded from the scan Returns: STRING */

netId.description: Unique ID of object or group. As this command is MP only, you can use BIS_fnc_netId, which extends the use to SP as well. See also: BIS_fnc_objectVar

isBurning.example: if (isBurning player) then { player groupChat "I'm burning!!"; }
isBurning.description: Returns whether the unit is burning. This returns true only if unit is damaged by nearby fire, it does not check whether a fireplace is burning, use inflamed command for that.

pixelGrid.description: Returns grid size based on screen resolution, UI size and configs: uiScaleFactor, uiScaleMaxGrids.

getDirVisual.description: Returns object's heading in the range from 0 to 360 in render time scope.

BIS_fnc_missileLaunchPositionFix.description: /* Description: Workaround fix for ATGM/SAM launch positions Parameter(s): 0: OBJECT - vehicle 1: OBJECT - projectile 2: STRING - selection to adjust missile's position to 3: STRING - type of projectile that should be adjusted Returns: BOOL - success Example: [_vehicle,_missile,"missile_move","MissileBase"] call BIS_fnc_missileLaunchPositionFix */

BIS_fnc_credits_movieSupport.description: /* File: fn_credits_movieSupport.sqf Description: Movie credits supporters preprocessor. Parameter(s): None. Returned value: _array: Array _array select 0: String - Position name (and tags) as structured text. _array select 1: String - Names (and tags) as structured text - 1st paragraph. _array select 2: String - Names (and tags) as structured text - 2nd paragraph. _array select 3: String - Names (and tags) as structured text - 3rd paragraph. _array select 4: Number - Required space coeficient (numberOfNamesInOneParagraph * textSizeCoef) */

allPlayers.example: { systemChat format [ "Player %1 is %2", name _x, ["dead", "alive"] select alive _x ]; } forEach allPlayers;
allPlayers.description: Returns a list of all human players including dead players. The command also returns all connected headless clients. To filter headless clients out: _justPlayers = allPlayers - entities "HeadlessClient_F"; NOTES:

BIS_fnc_callScriptedEventHandler.description: Calls all the codes assigned to scripted event handler with given name. Since

getPosASLVisual.description: Returns an object's rendered 3D position ASL (z value above sea level) in render time scope. Alias of visiblePositionASL.

get3DENActionState.description: Returns state of given action in the Eden Editor.

freeLook.example: systemChat (if freeLook then {"Quit looking around player!"} else {""});
freeLook.description: Returns true if freelook is active.

groupFromNetId.description: Get group with given unique ID. For objects use objectFromNetId. As this command is MP only, you can use BIS_fnc_groupFromNetId, which extends the use to SP as well.

getAmmoCargo.description: Returns the amount of ammo resources in the cargo space of a rearm vehicle.

BIS_fnc_curatorPinged.description: Show effects when player pings curator. Icon and entity list highlighting is handled by engine

BIS_fnc_execFSM.description: Execute the scripted FSM. Shell for execFSM command

BIS_fnc_initIntelObject.example: Setup an object as intel from its init attribute in the editor.
BIS_fnc_initIntelObject.description: The function sets up an object as intel retrievable by the players by adding a "Take Intel" addAction to it.

allAirports.description: Returns all map airports, both static and dynamic

endl.description: Creates a string containing a line break, similar to lineBreak for text. The name is inspired by c++ std::endl (line end). The command returns "\r\n", which contains control characters rather than printable characters:

BIS_fnc_effectFiredSmokeLauncher.description: /*ArmA 2 smokscreen, by Maddmatt Uses code from VBS2 Smoke launcher by Philipp Pilhofer (raedor) & Andrew Barron */

BIS_fnc_taskCompleted.description: Returns true if task has been completed.

attachedObjects.description: Returns a list of attached objects.

ropeUnwound.description: False if unwinding in progress, otherwise true

allowSprint.description: Force player to run/jog if set to false.

ctrlCreate.description: Creates a new control in the given display. The control class could be existing class from main config or custom class defined in mission config (mission config is searched first). Some of the common controls defined in main config that can be used with this command:

BIS_fnc_addRespawnPosition.description: Add a respawn position for respawn menu.

independent.example: SQF:if ((side _unit) == independent) then { hint "This is a independent unit!"; };
independent.description: Pre-defined variable for the independent side.

drawPolygon.example: test_polygon = []; for "_i" from 1 to 12 do { test_polygon pushBack (player getPos [10 + random 100, 360/_i]); }; findDisplay 12 displayCtrl 51 ctrlAddEventHandler ["Draw", { _this select 0 drawPolygon [test_polygon, [0,0,1,1]]; }];
drawPolygon.description: Draws given polygon on the given map control with given color. The polygon must consist of at least 3 points. Unlike with other draw<shape> commands and due to complexity, this command does not support filling of the polygon with color. Use drawTriangle command to construct and fill polygon shape as a workaround.

setVehicleReportRemoteTargets.description: Sets that the vehicle will share targets that were acquired by its own sensors via datalink to the Side center.

BIS_fnc_credits_movie.description: /* File: fn_credits_movie.sqf Description: Movie credits function. Parameter(s): _this select 0: Display - Display for credits. _this select 1: Number - Mode: 0 for end of credits, 1 for start of credits. Returned value: None */

ropeAttachedTo.description: Returns the ropes owner to which other objects are attached with ropes. This command is the opposite of ropeAttachedObjects.

BIS_fnc_setCuratorVisionModes.description: Set which vision modes curator can access.

setAmmoOnPylon.description: Set count of ammo in magazine on pylon

findIf.example: [unit1,unit2,unit3] findIf {!alive _x}; //return index of first dead unit
findIf.description: Searches for an element within array for which the code evaluates to true. Returns the 0 based index on success or -1 if not found. Code on the right side of the command is evaluated for each element of the array, processed element can be referenced in code as _x.

BIS_fnc_ambientAnimGetParams.description: Feeds params of given animset to BIS_fnc_ambientAnim.

hmd.description: Returns class name of currently used Head Mounted Display. Returns an empty string if the slot is empty.

BIS_fnc_loadInventory.example: loadout = [player,configfile >> "CfgVehicles" >> "B_Soldier_SL_F"] call BIS_fnc_loadInventory; // Gives loadout of BLUFOR Squad Leader to player unit.
BIS_fnc_loadInventory.description: Adds a predefined loadout (either via CfgVehicles, CfgRespawnInventory, or a custom inventory saved via BIS_fnc_saveInventory) to a specified unit.

fogParams.description: A getter for setFog (Alt Syntax). Returns extended params for the fog

curatorAddons.description: Returns list of addons allowed to given curator.

ctRowControls.description: Returns array of controls on the row with the given index.

canAdd.example: if (player canAdd "FirstAidKit") then { player addItem "FirstAidKit"; } else { hint "Not enough space"; };
canAdd.description: Checks if given object can be stored in inventory of given object or any inventory container (uniform, vest, backpack) of given unit.

set3DENIconsVisible.example: set3DENIconsVisible [ false, false ]; Hide all icons
set3DENIconsVisible.description: Toggle visibility of Eden Editor icons.

getHitIndex.description: Return current level of damage for a specific Hit Point (specified by its hit part index). All hit points can be obtained with getAllHitPointsDamage command.

setSimpleTaskCustomData.description: Set custom data for the task. Tooltip will be drawn in task list on the right side. Description will be drawn in task description panel on the bottom.

BIS_fnc_cinemaBorder.description: Creates cinematic borders. Player cannot move during cutscene.

BIS_fnc_moduleFDFadeMarker.description: Gradually change the alpha of the given marker.

taskAlwaysVisible.description: Returns true if the task is flagged to be always visible or false if not.

tvSetPictureRightColor.description: Sets color of the right picture on the tree view item defined by path

getAimingCoef.description: Get current aiming coefficient (higher ~ less precise, default is 1)

openDLCPage.description: Opens a Steam page of the app with given appId. Only works for known appId (game + linked DLCs)

ropeUnwind.example: ropeUnwind [ ropes heli1 select 0, 3, 10];//set rope length to 10m at 3m/s
ropeUnwind.description: Unwind rope to target length. Use relative parameter for changing rope length +/- from current length

BIS_fnc_typeText.example:
[ [ ["CAMP ROGAIN,","%1"], ["RESUPPLY POINT","%1
"], ["10 MINUTES LATER ...","%1"] ] ] spawn BIS_fnc_typeText;
BIS_fnc_typeText.description: Types a structured text on the screen, letter by letter, cursor blinking.

remove3DENConnection.example: remove3DENConnection ["RandomStart",get3DENSelected "Object","marker_0"] Remove random start on marker "marker_0" from all selected objects.

diag_mergeConfigFile.description: Adjust configs on-the-fly without the need of restarting the game (by merging the given config file into the main config in memory). Location is relative to the Userdir (default) or mission directory depending on the the value of UserDir [FileName,UserDir]. Doesn't work with cfgAmmo & few other classes. (Since 1.69, cfgAmmo should be mergeable!) Merging config file means also that you can't delete parameters through diag_mergeConfigFile. Changes applied by diag_mergeConfigFile are applied to all new entities so restart of mission is not necessarily required - spawning vehicle again or changing back forth weapon should usually do the trick.

BIS_fnc_textureMarker.description: Checks whether texture is defined in CfgMarkers and if so, returns the marker texture.

BIS_fnc_showUnitInfo.example: false call BIS_fnc_showUnitInfo; // hides weapon information
BIS_fnc_showUnitInfo.description: Hides or shows weapon information. Also hides grenades information.

removeAllActions.description: Removes all unit's user added actions.

getMissionConfig.example: _header = getMissionConfig "Header" Returns scenario header config. Replaces the previous approach which would scan only the external Description.ext file, but ignore the value set in the Eden Editor: _header = missionConfigFile >> "Header"; // Old approach
getMissionConfig.description: Returns Config entry for the given scenario attribute from the 1st tier. The attribute can be config class or config property. If it is defined in multiple places, the command checks them in the following order:

BIS_fnc_setServerVariable.description: Set variable stored only on server. Clients can the download it using BIS_fnc_getServerVariable. Used when you want to share variables only to specific clients to prevent large traffic.

BIS_fnc_unpackStaticWeapon.description: This function will move given support team to the given weapon position. The weapon crew will unpack carried weapon and start watching given target position. Requires three personnel in the team: Team Leader, Gunner and Asst. Gunner. This function is MP compatible.

BIS_fnc_setToPairs.description: /* Description: Sets an item in pair array to given value. Remarks: Works similar to the BIS_fnc_addToPairs but it doesn't try to add values. It just overwrites the volue if the key already exists. Example: [["apple",3],["pear",10]] = [[["apple",3],["pear",2]],"pear",10] call BIS_fnc_setToPairs; */

BIS_fnc_relPosObject.description: Place an object relative to another object, like a setRelPos command.

getAssignedCuratorLogic.description: Returns curator logic to which given player has access.

BIS_fnc_findOverwatch.syntax: [target, maxDistance, minDistance, minHeightAbove, searchCentre] call BIS_fnc_findOverwatch
BIS_fnc_findOverwatch.description: Selects a position that provides overwatch onto another position.

ropeEndPosition.description: Return rope end positions in Position3D format

setAirplaneThrottle.description: Sets a wanted throttle position, works only on player's vehicle.

BIS_fnc_moduleRating.example: [myLogic, units group player, true] call BIS_fnc_moduleRating;
BIS_fnc_moduleRating.description: Function used by the Rating module.

animationNames.description: Returns Array of Strings where elements are the names of model animations, which should theoretically be available for use with animate command. However in practice this depends on whether animation is also made available for use in scripts via config.

vestMagazines.description: Get array with all magazines from vest of the given unit.

addVest.description: Create a new vest and try to link it into vest slot.

isDamageAllowed.description: A getter for allowDamage command. The command indicates if damage is allowed at current locality, hence local effect of the command. A complete solution for being able to tell whether or not an object can be damaged at current locality looks like this: _canBeDamaged = local _obj && isDamageAllowed _obj;

BIS_fnc_taskReal.description: Find the actual task associated with a task name assigned to a unit.

difficultyOption.description: Checks specific difficulty settings of the current user. Difficulty flag names can be found in the CfgDifficultyPresets config class or in ArmA profile file under class DifficultyPresets/xxx/Options (xxx being Recruit, Regular or Veteran).

tvPicture.description: Returns name of picture from item pointed to by path. IDC means id of parent Tree View.

leaderboardRequestRowsFriends.description: Requests given leaderboard to download friends rows from the given leaderboard

getRepairCargo.description: Returns the amount of repair resources from empty (0) to full (1) in the cargo space of a repair vehicle.

objectParent.description: Returns parent of an object if the object is proxy, otherwise objNull. In case of backpack, the parent is a weaponholder or a cargo space of a vehicle or the unit carrying it. Unit in a vehicle will return the vehicle as parent.

BIS_fnc_blackOut.description: Register a black screen. Start the black screen when the first request is registered.

showUAVFeed.description: Shows/hides video feed transmitted from UAV. When enabled, the video is streamed to following texture

getPosWorld.description: Returns PositionWorld, which is PositionASL of the model centre [0,0,0] of an object, rather than transformed boundingCenter or LandContact vertices.

magazineTurretAmmo.description: Returns ammo count of given type from given turret

BIS_fnc_arrayShuffle.description: Return a new array with randomized order of elements from input array.

canVehicleCargo.example: Blackfish with no vehicle cargo loaded _result = blackfish canVehicleCargo offroad; //[true, true]
canVehicleCargo.description: Returns bool array if it is possible to load cargo inside vehicle and if possible to load cargo into empty vehicle

diag_activeMissionFSMs.description: Returns array with active Mission FSMs.

BIS_fnc_curatorAttachObject.description: Attach an object on another one under cursor.

BIS_fnc_toUpperDisplayTexts.description: /* Description: * Converts text of selected classes in one display to upper-case. * Searches inside Controls class of the display.
