Looks inside RscControlsGroup as well. * Doesn't toUpper class with name "PlayersName" (TODO - Maybe make it parameter as well). Parameter(s): 0: STRING - Class name of the display (e. g. "RscDisplayOptionsAudio"). 1: ARRAY OF STRINGS - Class names of parents of controls you want to toUpper (e. g. ["RscText", "RscTitle"]). 2 (Optional): ARRAY OF STRINGS - Class names of controls you don't want toUpper (e. g. ["CA_VehicleAuthor"] - suitable for toUppering all RscTexts except CA_VehicleAuthor). Returns: NOTHING */

markAsFinishedOnSteam.description: Marks current mission as finished on Steam. Returns true if Steam query is successfully started or false otherwise.

getFuelCargo.description: Returns the fuel amount (between 0 and 1) in the cargo space of a refuelling vehicle.

getPilotCameraRotation.description: Returns rotation (relative to the centered camera position) of the object airplane or helicopter pilotCamera .

tvCount.description: Returns childrens count of item on given path. IDC means id of parent Tree View.

BIS_fnc_setFog.description: Instantly set weather conditions and share it across network.

setVehicleAmmoDef.description: Sets how much ammunition (compared to the configuration of magazines defined in the vehicle's class) the vehicle has. Note that the ammo will only be added to local turrets. To check the locality of turret use turretLocal.

getAssignedCuratorUnit.description: Returns unit assigned to curator logic.

inAreaArray.description: Filters given list of Objects and/or Positions in relation to the given area, defined by a trigger, marker, location or array. Returns array of Objects and/or Positions from the list that are inside the area

get3DENConnections.description: Return all connections currently present on an entity.

BIS_fnc_diagMacros.description: /* Description: Exports config macros. Parameter(s): 0: CONFIG or ARRAY - config container to be searched (e.g. configFile >> "CfgVehicles") or list of classes or classnames 1: ARRAY - list of macro names to be used (e.g. ["MAPSIZE","NAMESOUND"]) 2 (Optional): STRING - macro category name (when param 0 is CONFIG, its classname is used by default - e.g. "CfgVehicles") Returns: STRING */

ropeAttachEnabled.description: Returns true if vehicle can be attached to ropes

isIRLaserOn.description: Returns true if there is a linked and enabled IR on the given weapon.

tvSetPictureRightColorSelected.description: Sets the color of the right picture of a tree item defined by path when item is selected

setHUDMovementLevels.syntax: setHUDMovementLevels [minSpeed, maxSpeed, minAlt, maxAlt, minDir, maxDir, targetOrPosition]
setHUDMovementLevels.description: Set min/max movement borders displayed in HUD gauges. Use -1 to skip some value.

tvSetPictureColorDisabled.description: Sets the color of left picture of a tree item defined by path when item is disabled

isStreamFriendlyUIEnabled.description: Returns the status of STREAM FRIENDLY UI setting in UI (OPTIONS >> GAME >> GENERAL >> STREAM FRIENDLY UI).

ropeAttachedObjects.description: Returns an array of all objects that are attached to a vehicle with ropes. This command is the opposite of ropeAttachedTo.

BIS_fnc_InstructorFigure.description: /******************************************************************************* Version: 0.1 Name: Instructor Figure DESCRIPTION: www. PARAMETERS: 1) function called - string, list of functions: - Init - Destroy 2) parameter for the function For more informations see https://wiki.bistudio.com/index.php/A3_InstructorFigure RETURNED VALUE: depends on the function called TODO: + PlayTopic + Fade out New Intel text + wait for TAB press + use functions for dynamic text - kbTell support - logging + rework data structure (add, remove, search) - ContainerExists function + display only if difficulty is low + disableSerialization + GetTopics should return array, not just debuglog info + deny play more than one topic in a time + Localize + check and fix return values of functions + correct debuglog informations - deny addtopic during playing + safe work with BIS_GroupCommunication - dont overwrite user menus + remove INSTRUCTOR FIGURE from BIS_GroupCommunication + PlayTopicRandom - rule exceeding selection of a previous sentence *******************************************************************************/ //Variables

BIS_fnc_selectRespawnTemplate.description: Select respawn template from CfgRespawnTemplates and execute its script / function. Internal use.

backpackMagazines.description: Get array with all magazines from backpack of the given unit.

getModelInfo.description: Returns object's model info in format [modelName, modelPath, hasSkeleton]. Model path is suitable for use with createSimpleObject command.

addHeadgear.description: Creates a headgear item and tries to link it to headgear slot. If slot is occupied with another item, the item in the slot will be replaced.

BIS_fnc_addScore.description: Adds a set amount of points to the score of a unit (MP only)

triggerTimeoutCurrent.description: Returns current timeout of the given trigger or -1 if countdown is not in progress.

BIS_fnc_createSimpleObject.example: ["B_Boat_Armed_01_minigun_F", getPosWorld player, getDir player] call BIS_fnc_createSimpleObject;
BIS_fnc_createSimpleObject.syntax: [input, position, direction, followTerrain, forceSuperSimpleObject] call BIS_fnc_createSimpleObject
BIS_fnc_createSimpleObject.description: Creates non-simulated framerate and network performance friendly object - a simple object - and applies different adjustments to fake non-existing physX and engine interactions. The adjustments need either to be stored in the object config or provided as the function input, otherwise they need to be done manually.

getItemCargo.description: Returns all items names and count from ammo box (or any general weapon holder container).

visibleScoretable.description: Checks whether the score table is visible.

deleteGroupWhenEmpty.description: Marks given group for auto-deletion when group is empty. true will mark the group for auto-deletion, however false will only unmark the group that was marked previously. There are other engine group auto-deletion mechanisms in place, which are not affected by this.

BIS_fnc_setRespawnDelay.description: /* Description: Increase the respawn time based on a condition Parameter(s): 0: CODE - Condition, must return BOOL 1: NUMBER - delay in seconds which is applied when the condition is true 2: STRING - description displayed when the delay is in effect Returns: NOTHING */

slingLoadAssistantShown.example: waitUntil {slingLoadAssistantShown}; hint "You lack rudimentary motor skills and basic eye-hand coordination."; //scold user for unethical practices
slingLoadAssistantShown.description: Returns true of Sling Load Assistant is open

BIS_fnc_EXP_camp_playSubtitles.example: [ ["CROSSROAD","Mission is a go, I repeat, mission is a go! Crossroad, out.",0] ] spawn BIS_fnc_EXP_camp_playSubtitles;//Shows a subtitle immediately
BIS_fnc_EXP_camp_playSubtitles.description: Displays the given subtitles at the correctly defined moments. Each array added to the parameters represents one subtitle.

addWeaponGlobal.description: Add a weapon to a unit. Infantry units can only carry weapons in their respective slots (primary, secondary and handgun), the addWeaponGlobal command will replace the weapon currently in a slot with the added weapon if it shares the same slot. To make sure the added weapon is loaded and ready, add the magazine first.

is3DEN.example: if is3DEN then {systemChat "Welcome to Eden Editor!"};
is3DEN.description: Returns true if the Eden Editor is currently being used. true when inside editor environment, false during preview. (see also is3DENMultiplayer)

BIS_fnc_crewCount.example: crewCount = ["B_Heli_Light_01_F",false] call BIS_fnc_crewCount; // Counts all available seats excluding cargo slots. Returns 6 (see notes).
BIS_fnc_crewCount.description: Function that counts amount of seats, both for crew and cargo seats.

isSprintAllowed.description: Returns true if player is allowed to sprint

diag_recordTurretLimits.description: Start recording tool for creating turret aiming limits.

BIS_fnc_exportCfgPatches.description: Export list of addons for Community Wiki http://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3:_Assets.

BIS_fnc_isLoading.description: Check if a loading screen is opened.

getPlateNumber.description: Get the license plates from any vehicle which has plates configured.

addItemToVest.description: Create new item and store it to soldier's vest. The item can also be a weapon or a magazine.

set3DENAttribute.example: player set3DENAttribute ["allowDamage",false ]; Mark player as invincible

BIS_fnc_diagAAR.description: Fill an AAR (After Action Review) display with data and Event Handlers.

BIS_fnc_damageChanged.description: Handle effects caused by changing of damage.

setVehicleReceiveRemoteTargets.description: Sets that the vehicle will be able to receive targets acquired by someone else via datalink from the Side center.

getArtilleryETA.description: Returns ETA to the target in seconds for given artillery unit based on target position and used magazine, -1 if target can't be hit.

shownUAVFeed.description: Returns true if video feed transmitted from UAV is shown. A getter for showUAVFeed

BIS_fnc_exportCuratorCostTable.description: /* Description: Generate spreadsheet with object classes and copy it to clipboard. The table will generate export code to be used in BIS_fnc_curatorObjectRegisteredTable Parameter(s): 0 (Optional): ARRAY of STRINGs - supported addons (classes from CfgPatches). When empty, all preloaded addons will be added. Use empty string to export just the cost calculation. 1 (Optional): STRING - format, can be "ods" or "xls" 2 (Optional): STRING - name of sheet with cost calculation. When empty, the calculation will be inserted on top of the table 3 (Optional): ARRAY of SIDEs or NUMBERs - filter only objects of listed sides or side IDs. Supported sides are west, east, resistance, civilian, sideUnknown and sideLogic 4 (Optional): CODE - condition for class to be listed. Config path to the class is passed as an argument (default: {true}) 5 (Optional): CODE - default cost, must return STRING. When empty string is returned, no default cost will be used (default: {""}) Returns: BOOL */

waypointTimeoutCurrent.description: Gets the current timeout for currentWaypoint of a group or -1 if countdown is not in progress.

BIS_fnc_sideIsFriendly.example: _isFriendly = [west, east] call BIS_fnc_sideIsFriendly; //Checks if EAST is friendly to WEST.
BIS_fnc_sideIsFriendly.description: Determines if side B is friendly to side A the way the game engine does it. The relationship table can be found here: Side relations.

BIS_fnc_setUnitInsignia.description: Sets unit insignia (e.g., shoulder insignia on soldiers). See Arma 3 Unit Insignia for more details. This function is global and should work from any client. Do not remote execute

canAddItemToVest.example: _item = "HandGrenade"; _fits = player canAddItemToVest _item; if (_fits) then { player addItemToVest _item; } else { hint "no room!"; };
canAddItemToVest.description: Checks if given object can be stored into soldier's vest.

BIS_fnc_objectSide.description: Returns object side as defined in config (i.e. not affected by dynamic changing like rating)

didJIP.description: Checks if the current client Joined In Progress.

BIS_fnc_respawnCounter.description: Set or execute respawn counter params.

backpackContainer.description: Returns a cargo container of a unit's backpack.

setNameSound.description: Sets the nameSound of a person. By default, when giving orders, the units are addressed by their number. When nameSound is set, it will be used instead to address the unit. For example: "Two, hold fire!", one can have: "Miller, hold fire!"

simulInClouds.description: Returns if given position is in clouds.

BIS_fnc_drawMinefields.description: Draw minefields on the map. Dynamically calculated from all mines positions. Distinguishes AP and AT minefields.

BIS_fnc_diagAARrecord.description: Starts recording units position and events for an AAR (After Action Review).

BIS_fnc_effectKilledSecondaries.description: //Small secondary fuel explosions //By Maddmatt for ArmA 2

getMissionConfigValue.example: _respawnDelay = getMissionConfigValue ["respawnDelay",0] Returns respawn delay value. Replaces the previous approach which would scan only the external Description.ext file, but ignore the value set in the Eden Editor: _respawnDelay = getNumber (missionConfigFile >> "respawnDelay"); // Old approach
getMissionConfigValue.description: Returns value of the given scenario attribute from the 1st tier. Since only config properties have values, the attribute should be config property. If it is not found or config class is given, the return is nil. If the attribute defined in multiple places, the command checks them in the following order:

addGoggles.description: Create a new item and try to link it into goggles slot. This command doesn't add NVGoggles. Use addItem and assignItem or just linkItem for latter.

showCuratorCompass.description: Hides or shows compass in curator interface.

disableUAVConnectability.description: Disables unit's AV terminal(s) connecting to UAV.

tvSetPictureColor.description: Sets the colour of the picture (set via tvSetPicture) under the specified tree view path.

ppEffectEnabled.description: Checks whether given post process effect is enabled

allDisplays.description: Returns a list of all opened GUI displays. Other displays, such as IGUI displays could be accessed via uiNamespace variable, which is updated every time display is opened or closed. For example, to access IGUI displays: uiNamespace getVariable ["IGUI_displays", []];. Other display variables:

underwater.description: Return whether object is fully underwater. From Arma 3 v1.66, this also works for units.

current3DENOperation.description: Returns the currently performed editing operation in Eden Editor.

magazinesDetailUniform.description: Returns an array with the type names of all the unit's uniform magazines.

pixelGridBase.description: Returns grid size based on screen resolution.

windDir.example: if (windDir < 45 || windDir > 315) then { hint "I feel a northern wind"; };

BIS_fnc_friendlySides.description: Returns sides allied to the given side / object.

inPolygon.description: Checks whether position is inside given polygon

BIS_fnc_loadFunctions.description: Compile scripts and save them into globally available functions. Defines _fnc_scriptName variable.

BIS_fnc_removeRespawnInventory.description: Remove a respawn inventory added by BIS_fnc_addRespawnInventory.

actionParams.description: Returns Array with params for given user action id (similar to addAction param array). The output array is of the following format: [title, script, arguments, priority, showWindow, hideOnUse, shortcut, condition, radius, unconscious, textWindowBackground, textWindowForeground, selection], where:

BIS_fnc_diagVehicleIcons.description: Previews all vehicle icons on map.

removeCuratorEditableObjects.description: Unregister objects which can be edited by a curator.

BIS_fnc_weaponAddon.description: Return addon from CfgPatches to which a given weapon class belongs to.

get3DENLayerEntities.description: Return all entities and sub-layer in Eden Entity layer.

edit3DENMissionAttributes.description: Open a window with scenario attribute in given section.

BIS_fnc_areFriendly.description: Function that takes two Sides and compares them, returning whether they are friendly or not.

magazinesDetailBackpack.description: Returns an array with the type names of all the unit's backpack magazines.

skillFinal.description: Returns final, recalculated sub skill value of given unit. (with regard to AI Level coefficient (Difficulty settings)).

BIS_fnc_execVM.description: execVM desired script with desired argument(s). This function is only really useful when combined with BIS_fnc_MP to execute a script remotely.

BIS_fnc_curatorObjectRegisteredTable.example: // Nothing but the listed flare modules will show up in the curator's unit list
BIS_fnc_curatorObjectRegisteredTable.description: Register curator object costs from a table.

setSpeaker.description: Sets the speaker of a person. In order to setSpeaker dynamically in MP, the command needs to run on every computer with exactly the same params otherwise the speaking unit could appear silent on other PCs. Run this on server:

BIS_fnc_colorRGBAtoTexture.description: Converts RGB color format to procedural texture, e.g [0,0,0,1] becomes "#(argb,8,8,3)color(0,0,0,1)".

BIS_fnc_prepareAO.description: Spawns random patrols and/or vehicles in trigger areas with proper names. Side selected in the triggers "Activation" listbox will determine the side of the spawned asset(s).

getCargoIndex.example: player moveInCargo heli; hint str (heli getCargoIndex player);
getCargoIndex.description: Returns index of the unit in cargo. 0,1,2... or -1 if not in cargo.

BIS_fnc_onDiaryChanged.description: /* Description: Register code to be executed when diary item changes. Arguments passed into code are: 0: DISPLAY - map display 1: BOOL - true if clicked on subject list, false when on record list (clicking on subject may also trigger record) 2: STRING - subject name 3: STRING - record name 4: ANY - passed arguments (index of onDiaryChanged code when no custom arguments were used) Parameter(s): _this: CODE ARRAY - code with custom arguments in format [CODE,ARG1,ARG2,...] NUMBER - remove code of given index Returns: NUMBER - index of onDiaryChanged code */

BIS_fnc_liveFeedModuleInit.description: /* Description: Display a live feed via a module. Parameters: _this: OBJECT - Live Feed - Init module */ // Need not be run on dedicated servers

BIS_fnc_advHintCall.description: Advanced hint call, creates hint itself.

BIS_fnc_removeSupportLink.description: Removes support types during a mission.

BIS_fnc_ambientAnimCombat.syntax: [unit, animationset, equipmentlevel, condition, behaviour] call BIS_fnc_ambientAnimCombat;
BIS_fnc_ambientAnimCombat.description: Play set of ambient animations on given unit AND allows the unit to leave the ambient state and engage enemy or move away.

lbSetSelectColorRight.description: Sets the select color of the of the secondary text (right aligned) of the item with the given index of the listbox or combobox with id idc of the topmost user dialog to color.

setBleedingRemaining.description: Sets for how many seconds injured unit leaves blood trail. The unit damage must be >= 0.1 for this command to have an effect, otherwise, the getBleedingRemaining will return 0 and no blood trail is left behind.

tvClear.description: Removes all items from Tree View with given idc.

isObjectHidden.description: Checks visibility of a given object on the local machine.

enableAudioFeature.description: Enable/disable an audio feature, features are: "lowpass", "building_interior". Return previous state

cbSetChecked.description: Sets the current state of a checkbox (CT_CHECKBOX type 77 of Dialog Control). Use "CheckedChanged" control event handler with it.

shownChat.description: Returns true if chat window is enabled. Chat window can be disabled with showChat command.

setApertureNew.description: Sets custom camera aperture ([-1] to do it automatically).

objectCurators.description: Returns array with all curators which can edit given object.

getForcedFlagTexture.description: A getter for forceFlagTexture. Forced texture is different from your normal flag texture, which can be retrieved with flagTexture

BIS_fnc_packStaticWeapon.description: This function will make weapon team pack a static weapon. The weapon crew will pack carried weapon (or given weapon if different) and follow leader. Requires three personnel in the team: Team Leader, Gunner and Asst. Gunner. This function is MP compatible

BIS_fnc_removeRespawnPosition.description: Remove a respawn position added by BIS_fnc_addRespawnPosition.

BIS_fnc_getRespawnPositions.description: Return scripted respawn positions available for the given unit.

get3DENEntityID.description: Returns unique index of an Eden Entity. This number remains the same even after saving and loading the scenario.

allUnitsUAV.example: hint format ["No. of UAV(s) on the map: %1", count allUnitsUAV];
allUnitsUAV.description: Return a list of all UAV vehicles.

doorPhase.description: Return animation phase of door on vehicle.

getArtilleryComputerSettings.description: Returns settings from artillery computer currently opened by player.

BIS_fnc_baseWeapon.description: Determines base weapon class, with no attachments.

get3DENGrid.description: Returns the grid increment for the given transformation type.

isEqualTypeArray.description: Compares types of all elements of one array to types of all elements of another array.

ctSetData.description: Associates metadata (string) with the row determined by the index. Returns Nothing.

addWeaponItem.description: Adds a weapon item to the specified weapon. The item can be weapon magazine, in which case the amount of ammo and target muzzle could also be specified.

BIS_fnc_setOvercast.description: Instantly set weather conditions and share it across network. Must be executed in scheduled environment.

BIS_fnc_isForcedCuratorInterface.description: Return if curator interface is forced (user cannot leave it by pressing Zeus key).

unlinkItem.example: bluforUnit unlinkItem "NVGoggles"; opforUnit unlinkItem "NVGoggles_OPFOR"; independentUnit unlinkItem "NVGoggles_INDEP";
unlinkItem.description: Unassign and delete existing item from its assigned slot. If item does not exist or is not in the assigned slot, command simply fails.

getUnitTrait.description: Gets the current value of a trait of the given unit.

forcedMap.description: Returns if map was forced by using forceMap command or openMap command with force option

getRemoteSensorsDisabled.description: Get status of disabled raycasts for remote entities. See disableRemoteSensors for detailed description.

BIS_fnc_isCurator.description: Return if given object is curator logic.

BIS_fnc_scriptedWaypointType.description: Return CfgWaypoints type of scripted waypoint. Returns empty string/config when waypoint is not scripted Returns "Custom"/CfgWaypoints root when waypoint is using custom script.

get3DENSelected.example: systemChat str (get3DENSelected ""); /* outputs: [ [B Alpha 2-1:1],//objects [B Alpha 2-1],//groups [164494: <no shape>],//triggers [<No center> Charlie 1-2:4],//logic [ [B Alpha 2-1,0] ],//waypoints ["Hotel_Whiskey"]//markers ]*/
get3DENSelected.description: Returns an array of all selected Eden Editor Entities of the given type, or, if empty string "" is used, an array of 6 arrays in the following format:

confirmSensorTarget.description: Sets for which Side the entity becomes a "confirmed hostile" target - a target that becomes highlighted red on the sensors display.

pushBack.description: Insert an element to the back of the given array. This command modifies the original array. (see also: pushBackUnique)

BIS_fnc_moduleRespawnInventory.description: /* Description: Set respawn loadouts a curator can assign to players Parameter(s): 0: OBJECT - curator logic 1: BOOL - true to make all loadouts availale, false to base them on units the curator can place Returns: BOOL */

pixelH.description: Returns the height of one pixel for current resolution.

BIS_fnc_sortBy.example: // sort numbers from lowest to highest _sortedNumbers = [[1,-80,0,480,15,-40], [], {_x}, "ASCEND"] call BIS_fnc_sortBy;
BIS_fnc_sortBy.syntax: [array, parameters, algorithm, direction, filter] call BIS_fnc_sortBy
BIS_fnc_sortBy.description: Sorts an array according to given algorithm. See sort for simple sorts.

allDeadMen.description: Return a list of dead units including agents. Dead unit might be inside vehicle.

configProperties.description: Returns an array of config entries which meet criteria in condition code. Command iterates through available classes and config properties for given config entry. If 3rd param is true the search also includes inherited properties. Current looked at config is stored in _x variable (similar to alternative count command implementation). Condition has to return true in order for the looked at property to be added to the resulting array. A bit slower than configClasses but allows to access inherited entires.

BIS_fnc_missionConversations.description: /* Description: Header function of local mission conversations Parameter(s): 0: STRING - unique mode 1 (Optional): ANY - additional params Returns: BOOL */

flagTexture.description: Returns texture of the local instance of the flag. A getter for setFlagTexture. It will not return flag textures applied using forceFlagTexture, use getForcedFlagTexture for that.

isWeaponRested.description: Returns true if weapon is currently rested.

curatorEditingAreaType.description: Returns type of edit areas assigned to curator (blacklist/whitelist).

vehicleReportOwnPosition.description: Gets whether the vehicle shares its own position via datalink with the Side center.

ctrlClassName.example: List class names of all controls present on display 46:_ctrls = ""; for "_i" from -1 to 10000 do { with uiNamespace do { _ctrl = findDisplay 46 displayCtrl _i; if (!isNull _ctrl) then { _ctrls = _ctrls + format ["IDC: %1, Class Name: %2\n", _i, ctrlClassName _ctrl]; }; }; }; hint _ctrls;
ctrlClassName.description: Returns the class name of a Control as it is defined in config. If you need config class of a game created Display, it is stored on display itself: _className = findDisplay 12 getVariable ["BIS_fnc_initDisplay_configClass", ""]; // "RscDiary"

isStaminaEnabled.description: Check if stamina depletion is enabled

simulCloudOcclusion.description: Returns clouds occlusion between two given points (0 - no clouds, 1 - full clouds).

weaponsItemsCargo.description: Returns an array with subarrays contains class names and also names of connected items of all the vehicle's cargo weapons in weaponsItems format. If weapon has no magazine, an empty array [] is returned instead of magazine info.

BIS_fnc_isInZoom.example: if ([0.001,0.02] call BIS_fnc_isInZoom) then { hint "Zoom level is in between 0.001 and 0.02"; };
BIS_fnc_isInZoom.description: Checks if map zoom level is in between given interval (min,max)

getObjectTextures.description: Gets all custom textures (hiddenSelectionsTextures) associated with the object.

BIS_fnc_groupIndicator.description: Displays Group Indicator (to the right of the screen in

diag_codePerformance.description: Attempts to run given code with given arguments given number of cycles in unscheduled environment and returns average time it took to run the code as well as actual number of executions performed. The command will return as soon as possible if the tested code is slow and the duration of the command exceeds 1 second. Engine alternative to BIS_fnc_codePerformance

logNetwork.description: Registers new log file recording a network traffic and returns handle of the log. The log file is saved inside the Arma 3 root folder.

BIS_fnc_splitString.example: ["this is a test", " "] call BIS_fnc_splitString; // returns ["this", "is", "a", "test"]
BIS_fnc_splitString.description: Split spring according to given separators

getDescription.description: Returns the string representation of unit as an four slots array.

BIS_fnc_missionTasks.description: /* Description: Header function of local mission tasks. Automatically declares following variables: _taskID: STRING _taskState: STRING _taskExists: BOOL Parameter(s): 0: STRING - unique mode 1 (Optional): ANY - additional params 2 (Optional): CODE - specific task function (default: "BIS_fnc_missionTasksLocal") Returns: BOOL */

BIS_fnc_spawn.example: Show a message for the current player. [["Hello"], {hint (_this select 0);}] spawn BIS_fnc_spawn;
BIS_fnc_spawn.description: Execute given code with or without parameter.

get3DENLinesVisible.example: if (get3DENLinesVisible select 0) then {hint "Lines are visible in the map.";};
get3DENLinesVisible.description: Get visibility state of Eden Editor lines.

ctSetValue.description: Associates metadata (number) with the row determined by the index. Returns Nothing.

addTorque.example: Apply torque [1000,0,0] to object not factoring object positioning: _wheel addTorque [1000,0,0];
addTorque.description: Applies torque (rotation momentum) to the center of mass of the given object. Torque force is defined as vector [x, y, z] applied in world space. If you need to define torque in model space, convert the torque vector first by vectorModelToWorld or vectorModelToWorldVisual command. The torque applied as impulse. Diagram below explain which way the object would rotate. For more information see NVIDIA docs

cursorObject.description: Returns the object under cursor. This command is quite different from cursorTarget as it is more precise in determining the boundaries of the pointed at object and can detect a larger variety of objects including map objects and trees.

is3DENMultiplayer.example: if is3DENMultiplayer then {systemChat "Your hosting a test server!"};
is3DENMultiplayer.description: Returns true if the Eden Editor is in multiplayer mode. Returns true in the following cases:

ctrlTextWidth.description: Returns the control text width. Supported control types are:

ctFindHeaderRows.description: Takes index of a header as a parameter. Returns array of indices of rows under this header.

clearAllItemsFromBackpack.description: Removes all items from the backpack.

BIS_fnc_drawCuratorRespawnMarkers.description: /* Description: Create a curator icon on every respawn marker Parameter(s): 0: OBJECT - curator module 1: ARRAY of SIDEs Returns: BOOL */

worldToModelVisual.description: Converts position from world space to object model space in render time scope.

BIS_fnc_respawnEndMission.description: End a mission if all players are dead and there are no more respawn tickets (if any).

vectorNormalized.description: Returns normalized vector (unit vector, vectorMagnitude = 1) of given vector. If given vector is 0 result is a 0 vector as well.

BIS_fnc_VRTimer.description: Timer for VR and time trials. The following variables can be used:

enableSimulationGlobal.description: MP command. Enable or disable simulation for given entity, globally. Call this only from the server. Has the same effect as enableSimulation when used in SP.

BIS_fnc_cameraOld.example: [player] call BIS_fnc_cameraOld; // starts the camera on the player
BIS_fnc_cameraOld.description: Classic camera script, replaced by the Splendid™ BIS_fnc_camera.

serverCommandExecutable.description: Returns true if the serverCommand can be performed on the machine and in this exact environment, otherwise false. serverCommand can be executed only from User Interface Event Handlers, and this command also checks if that's the case.

diag_activeScripts.description: Returns 4 element array with numbers of currently running scripts in format: [spawn-ed, execVM-ed, exec-ed, execFSM-ed]

waypointLoiterType.description: Gets the waypoint loiter type. Waypoint uses format Waypoint.

getShotParents.description: Returns shot information Array for the given projectile in format [vehicle, instigator], where vehicle is the vehicle the shot was fired from, and the instigator is the person who pulled the trigger. If shot was fired by a soldier on foot or in FFV position in vehicle, the soldier is returned for the vehicle.

set3DENAttributes.example: set3DENAttributes [[get3DENSelected "Object","ControlMP",true ]]; Set all selected objects as playable

splitString.example: _str = "- This, is a sample string." splitString "-,. "; // ["This","is","a","sample","string"] _str joinString " "; // "This is a sample string"
splitString.description: An SQF version of C++ strtok. Splits given string str into an array of tokens according to given delimiters. In addition, if empty string "" is used for delimiters, str is split by each character.

unitIsUAV.description: Returns true if the unit type is UAV - coresponding to transport param "isUAV"

BIS_fnc_triggerToMarker.description: Makes an existing or new trigger cover a marker area.

BIS_fnc_fadeEffect.syntax: [fadeInOrOut, blackOrWhite, duration, blur, music, ending, success] call BIS_fnc_fadeEffect
BIS_fnc_fadeEffect.description: Easily carry out complex fading. Default values will be used if parameters aren't defined or set to nil.

BIS_fnc_curatorAttributes.description: /* Description: Return attributes available for given entity Parameter(s): 0: OBJECT - curator 1: OBJECT or GROUp or ARRAY or STRING - checked entity Returns: ARRAY of STRINGs */

buldozer_reloadOperMap.description: Reload oper map visible in costMap diag tool. Working only in buldozer.

getPersonUsedDLCs.description: Returns a list of all DLCs objects the unit is currently using. For example if a unit is inside a vehicle from DLC, it will return the code of that DLC.

curatorCameraAreaCeiling.description: Returns ceiling height for curator camera.

BIS_fnc_arsenal.example: [ "Open", [ true ] ] call BIS_fnc_arsenal;Opens Arsenal with all items
BIS_fnc_arsenal.description: Function used for Virtual Arsenal. The function features four different modes, each mode comes with its own paramters.

allMapMarkers.description: Return all markers in map including user placed markers (_USER_DEFINED #).

get3DENAttribute.example: systemChat str ((get3DENMouseOver select 1) get3DENAttribute "name"); // returns variable name of object under cursor
get3DENAttribute.description: Returns the value of the given entity's attribute in Eden Editor.

isMultiplayerSolo.description: Returns true when playing a game in solo multiplayer (for example Apex coop campaign PLAY SOLO option).

getMusicPlayedTime.description: Returns elapsed time in seconds for currently playing music track.

BIS_fnc_selectDiarySubject.description: Select diary subject. Temporary replacement for selectDiarySubject scripting command which is currently broken.

checkVisibility.description: Checks if one position is visible from another position and how much. The results can be affected by getTerrainGrid value, especially if position is near the ground. Particle effects such as smoke can also affect the results.

isSteamMission.example: if (isSteamMission) then { hint "Thank you for subscribing to my mission on Steam!"; } else { hint "Thank you for downloading my mission off the Internet!"; };
isSteamMission.description: Returns true if the current mission is a Steam Workshop mission.

BIS_fnc_diagKnownTargets.description: Visualize and profile which units one specific unit knows about and how much. Calling function again stops diagnostics.

apply.description: Applies given code to each element of the array and returns resulting array. The value of the current array element, to which the code will be applied, is stored in variable _x.

BIS_fnc_sideColor.description: Returns colour of define side either as Array in format RGBA or the name of the colour as String

allTurrets.example: _turretPaths = allTurrets SlammerUP; //[[0],[0,0]] _turretPaths = allTurrets [SlammerUP, true]; //[[0],[0,0]] <- Commander turret is also FFV turret _turretPaths = allTurrets [SlammerUP, false]; //[[0]]
allTurrets.description: Returns array of available turret paths from vehicle object. To look up turrets from config, use BIS_fnc_allTurrets

triggerDynamicSimulation.description: Controls ability of given unit to activate entities with disabled Arma_3_Dynamic_Simulation. If false dynamically disabled entities will not be activated by unit presence

visibleWatch.description: Checks if the player has watch opened and visible

enableUAVWaypoints.example: _uav enableUAVWaypoints false; hint str waypointsEnabledUAV _uav; // returns false
enableUAVWaypoints.description: Enables/disables the option for player to set waypoints for UAV in AV terminal.

BIS_fnc_completedCuratorChallengesCount.description: Return number of completed curator challenges.

setOxygenRemaining.description: Sets oxygen remaining. It has no effect when soldier is not diving. Oxygen remaining is a number between 0 and 1.

customChat.example: _unit customChat [1, "Hi, I am a custom chat message"];
customChat.description: Sends the chat message to the custom radio channel. The radio channel needs to be created on the server before hand, with radioChannelCreate command.

getSlingLoad.description: Return object which is sling loaded by vehicle

moonPhase.description: Returns the phase of the in-game Moon on the given date in range 0...1, where 0 - new Moon, 1 - full Moon. According to this command the fullest Moon in Arma 3 at midnight is on setDate [4804,7,13,0,0]; Use Moon Phase Utility to find out date for a mission with desired moon.

BIS_fnc_feedbackMain.description: Main feedback FSM, used for feedback effects (fatigue, drowning, injury etc.). Internal use only.

BIS_fnc_setIDCStreamFriendly.description: Shows or hides UI control according to state of the Stream Friendly UI switch in Game Options.

setRandomLip.description: Enables/Disables random lip. When enabled, the unit continuously moves its lips as if it's talking.

setWaves.description: Changes the waves value smoothly during the given time (in seconds). A time of zero means there will be an immediate change.

isVehicleSensorEnabled.description: Returns class name (to identify list based on component name) and info if given sensor is enabled

getSuppression.description: Gets the suppression value of given unit. Returns SCALAR between 0 and 1. Suppression is not calculated for player entities.

removeMissionEventHandler.example: for "_i" from 0 to 4 do { missionNamespace setVariable [ format ["handler%1",_i],addMissionEventHandler ["Loaded","hint ""_i"";"]]; }; removeMissionEventHandler ["Loaded",handler2]; //Remove the third index under type "Loaded"
removeMissionEventHandler.description: Removes mission event handler added by addMissionEventHandler. When any handler is removed, all handler indices higher that the deleted one should be decremented.

isInRemainsCollector.example: if (isInRemainsCollector unit1) then {hint "unit1 is queued for disposal"};
isInRemainsCollector.description: Checks if unit or vehicle is queued for disposal after death.

hideSelection.description: Hides or enables the given selection for the object

get3DENMouseOver.description: Returns the Eden Entity the mouse is hovering over in Eden Editor.

BIS_fnc_addVirtualItemCargo.description: Add virtual items to an object (e.g., ammo box). Virtual items can be selected in the Arsenal.

BIS_fnc_localize.example: // assuming the stringtable contains a key "STR_someString" with the value "Hello world" "STR_someString" call BIS_fnc_localize; // returns "Hello world" // assuming the stringtable does not contain a key "STR_anotherString" "STR_anotherString" call BIS_fnc_localize; // returns "STR_anotherString"
BIS_fnc_localize.description: Checks if passed string is localization key and if so, return the localized text. Else, returns the passed string itself.

assignedItems.description: Get array with all assigned items.

BIS_fnc_neutralizeUnit.description: Neutralize an object by intrinsic means:

BIS_fnc_smoothStep.description: Interpolates between 0 and 1 with smoothing at the limits. Formula is n² × (3 - 2n).

loadAbs.description: Returns current sum of mass from items stored in all unit's containers, linked items and weapons.

ctrlAnimateModel.description: Process an animation of 3D Dialog Control. Command uses name defined by source property and works similar like animateSource command.

currentChannel.example: _selected = currentChannel; // 3 - for example for the Group
currentChannel.description: Returns currently selected user chat channel on the UI (selected with < and > in MP). Correspondence between channel and number:

BIS_fnc_addCuratorAreaFromTrigger.description: Add curator editing / camera area based on triggers.

revealMine.description: Sets given mine as known to the side. (Knowledge about a mine is always shared across all units in a side.)

BIS_fnc_objectVar.example: hint str (player call BIS_fnc_objectVar); // "bis_o1" hint str (player == (missionNamespace getVariable "bis_o1")); // true
BIS_fnc_objectVar.description: Return a unique object variable. The variable is preserved after unit respawn.

AGLToASL.description: Converts position from PositionAGL to PositionASL

BIS_fnc_disableSaving.description: Controls the disabling of saving, stacking each request to prevent saving being enabled too early.

setCurrentChannel.example: _isDirectSelected = setCurrentChannel 5; // sets Direct channel as current active
setCurrentChannel.description: Sets given channel as current chat channel. Scripted way of selecting desired channel on the UI. The given channel may be disabled (see enableChannel), this is why this command returns boolean, true on success or false on failure. Correspondence between channel and number:

ctAddHeader.description: Adds a header line of controls according to the HeaderTemplate class. It returns an array containing header index and array of created controls in a format [<headerIndex>, [<control0>, <control1>...<control n>]].

setMusicEventHandler.description: Sets given music track event handler. Will overwrite other music event handlers. Use addMusicEventHandler if you want to stack them.

currentNamespace.example: if (currentNamespace isEqualTo uiNamespace) then {hint "This is uiNamespace"};
currentNamespace.description: Returns current global namespace the script runs in.

BIS_fnc_getCfgDataObject.description: /* Description: Get the object defined in cfg by its name (global variable). Remark(s): * Can by called 2 ways: * 1st way (general) works for any config. * 2nd way is for comfortable working with mission description.ext. Parameter(s): _this: CFG _this: ARRAY of STRINGS - missionConfigFile classes and an attribute. Example: * 1st way of calling: _value = (missionconfigfile >> "Hubs" >> "A1" >> "QuickStart" >> "trigger") call BIS_fnc_getCfgDataObject; * 2nd way of calling: _value = ["Hubs","A1","QuickStart","trigger"] call BIS_fnc_getCfgDataObject; Returns: OBJECT or OBJNULL */

addItemPool.description: Adds count items of type name into the weapon pool (used in the campaign to transfer items to the next mission)

BIS_fnc_setCuratorCamera.description: Move curator camera to a position and direction. Finished when animation ends.

createVehicleCrew.description: Creates crew to given empty vehicle. Crew members are default crew defined in config. Crew side will also correspond to vehicle's faction.

removeCuratorAddons.description: Restrict curator use of given addons.

clearBackpackCargo.description: Removes all backpacks from ammo box (or any general weapon holder container).

ppEffectForceInNVG.description: Forces use of Post process effects in NVG.

BIS_fnc_removeCuratorIcon.description: Remove icon displayed in curator interface.

BIS_fnc_initMultiplayer.description: Multiplayer mission init, executed automatically upon mission start.

assignItem.example: bluforUnit addItem "NVGoggles"; bluforUnit assignItem "NVGoggles"; opforUnit addItem "NVGoggles_OPFOR"; opforUnit assignItem "NVGoggles_OPFOR"; independentUnit addItem "NVGoggles_INDEP"; independentUnit assignItem "NVGoggles_INDEP";
assignItem.description: Assigns existing item from inventory (uniform, vest, backpack) to a correct slot. If the slot is occupied by another item, it gets replaced.

tvExpand.description: Expands tree item pointed to by the path. IDC means id of parent Tree View.

BIS_fnc_diagMacrosNameSound.description: Detects vehicle types and prints their radio protocol definitions to clipboard.

magazinesAmmoCargo.description: Returns an array of subarrays with the type names and ammo left of all the vehicle's cargo or container magazines.

getRelDir.description: Returns direction, which is relative to object's current direction, from given object to another object or position in the range from 0 to 360, the equivalent of BIS_fnc_relativeDirTo. Taking the current direction of the object into account.

enableWeaponDisassembly.description: Enables or disables disassembly of static weapons. Could be applied to local player, to another unit or to static weapon directly.

addForce.example: Apply force [0,1000,0] defined in world space (not factoring object actual positioning) to object position [1,0,0]: _object addForce [[0,1000,0],[1,0,0]];
addForce.description: Applies force to given object at given position. Force is defined as vector [x, y, z] in world space, position is vector [x, y, z] in model space. If you need to define force in model space, use vectorModelToWorld or vectorModelToWorldVisual commands first. The force applied as impulse. For more information see NVIDIA docs

nearSupplies.description: Find supplies (weapon holders, ammo crates, fuel feeds, other units) in the sphere with given radius.

BIS_fnc_bleedTickets.example: [] call BIS_fnc_bleedTickets; // Uses all default values to start the system.
BIS_fnc_bleedTickets.description: Function that handles bleeding ticket system. Tickets are set beforehand using BIS_fnc_respawnTickets.

simulSetHumidity.description: Sets simul cloud cover. This command does not affect overcast value. This command has now been removed

getWeaponSway.description: Returns current size of weapon sway of a given unit, in radians

forceWeatherChange.example: 240 setOvercast 1; 360 setRain 1; forceWeatherChange; comment "force immediate change overriding smooth transition";
forceWeatherChange.description: Forces saved wanted settings for weather to be actual (BEWARE: Will cause lag).

BIS_fnc_ORBATAddGroupOverlay.syntax: [target, texture, colour, widthMulti, heightMulti, angle, text, shadow] call BIS_fnc_ORBATAddGroupOverlay
BIS_fnc_ORBATAddGroupOverlay.description: Register texture(s) to be displayed over CfgORBAT group.

diag_setLightNew.description: Overrides currently used scene lightning. The operand is config that is placed as a string (not file). The changes may not be applied immediately, but can be forced by the call of simulWeatherSync.

drawIcon3D.example: Icon and text:addMissionEventHandler ["Draw3D", { drawIcon3D ["targetIcon.paa", [1,1,1,1], ASLToAGL getPosASL cursorTarget, 1, 1, 45, "Target", 1, 0.05, "TahomaB"]; };
drawIcon3D.syntax: drawIcon3D [texture, color, pos, width, height, angle, text, shadow, textSize, font, textAlign, drawSideArrows]
drawIcon3D.description: Draws an ingame icon at a given position. Command has to be executed each frame. Use onEachFrame or addMissionEventHandler "Draw3D". In order for the results of this command to be visible through a custom camera, enable HUD with cameraEffectEnableHUD

BIS_fnc_colorConfigToRGBA.description: Converts config color format to RGBA array of numbers.

createSimpleObject.example: _pos = player getRelPos [10, 0]; _tank = createSimpleObject ["a3\armor_f_beta\apc_tracked_01\apc_tracked_01_rcws_f.p3d", _pos]; _tank setPos (_pos vectorAdd (getPosWorld _tank vectorDiff (_tank modelToWorld [0,0,0]))); _tank hideSelection ["zasleh", true]; _tank hideSelection ["zasleh2", true]; _tank hideSelection ["clan", true]; _tank animate ["Wheel_podkoloL3", 0.5, true]; _tank animate ["Wheel_podkoloL6", 0.5, true];
createSimpleObject.description: Create object with given shape defined as path to .p3d model. Supported LODs include Geometry, Fire Geometry, Roadway, View Geometry and ShadowVolume. Supported features include collision, texturing, animation, penetration, AI spotting occlusion, and surface specific sounds (like footsteps). Unsupported features include PhysX, damage, AI pathfinding (causes walking through walls), and built in lights.

BIS_fnc_mirrorCuratorSettings.description: Mirrors settings from one curator to another.

diag_list.description: Returns an array of all diag modes available in the game.

removeAllHandgunItems.description: Removes all items from weapon except magazine.

cbChecked.description: Returns the current state of a checkbox (CT_CHECKBOX type 77 of Dialog Control).

BIS_fnc_taskType.description: /* Description: Returns type of given task. Parameters: 0: STRING - task id Returns: STRING - task type or type 'Default' if not defined */

inRangeOfArtillery.description: Returns true if all given units are able to fire at given position with given magazineType.

setPosASLW.description: Sets the object position above sea surface. The pos array uses the PositionASLW format.

setDefaultCamera.description: Sets the position and direction for the camera used after camera is set on no object (log out view when leaving MP game for example)

mineDetectedBy.description: Returns true if mine has been detected by a given side

BIS_fnc_animalSiteSpawn.description: Create an area that spawns animals. The animals will be created or deleted if a player is inside or outside the area's radius. Can only be used by the server or in singleplayer.

setCuratorCameraAreaCeiling.description: Sets maximal height to which curator camera can move.

fullCrew.description: Returns array with all crew inside given vehicle. Since Arma 3 v1.55.133810 it is possible to return empty seats as well.

isTouchingGround.description: Returns true if object is touching the ground.

canSlingLoad.description: Returns true if it is possible to sling load cargo

airDensityRTD.description: Returns air density in given altitude

removeAllMusicEventHandlers.description: Removes all music track event handlers of given type.

vectorDirVisual.description: Return object's normalized direction vector in world space ([x,y,z]) in render time scope.

isVehicleCargo.example: Blackfish with given variable name blackfish, with a vehicle inside called quad _transportingVehicle = isVehicleCargo quad; //returns blackfish //Vehicle called quad that is not being transported as cargo _transportingVehicle = getVehicleCargo quad; //returns objNull
isVehicleCargo.description: Return transporting vehicle if vehicle is loaded in one.

tvSetPicture.description: Sets picture to item selected by path. IDC means id of parent Tree View. Name is picture name. The picture is searched in the mission directory.

waypointLoiterRadius.description: Gets the waypoint loiter radius. Waypoint uses format Waypoint.

boundingBoxReal.example: _bbr = boundingBoxReal vehicle player; _p1 = _bbr select 0; _p2 = _bbr select 1; _maxWidth = abs ((_p2 select 0) - (_p1 select 0)); _maxLength = abs ((_p2 select 1) - (_p1 select 1)); _maxHeight = abs ((_p2 select 2) - (_p1 select 2));
boundingBoxReal.description: Returns a bounding box of given object in model coordinates space. This command is similar to boundingBox but gives more precise measurements.

addPrimaryWeaponItem.description: Adds weapon item to the weapon cargo space. This is used for infantry weapons.

magazinesAllTurrets.description: Returns all magazines (including empty) from all vehicle turrets (including driver turret [-1]) and their ammo counts.

BIS_fnc_allTurrets.description: Returns all vehicle turrets from config with options. Does what allTurrets command does, except the param is vehicle's config class name

BIS_fnc_sayMessage.description: Make a speaker say a message.

BIS_fnc_getServerVariable.description: Fetch a variable saved on server. Used when you want to share variables only to specific clients to prevent large traffic. Must be spawned because communication with server takes some time.

BIS_fnc_inString.example: ["rabbit", "I ate a rabbit today"] call BIS_fnc_inString // will return true
BIS_fnc_inString.description: Find a string within a string.

uniformItems.description: Get array with all items (of any kind, even weapons) from uniform.

enableVehicleCargo.description: Enable/disable option to transport other vehicles (if configured) or be transported.

BIS_fnc_ORBATSetGroupFade.description: Set fade value of CfgORBAT group and all groups below it.

ctrlSetPixelPrecision.example: _control ctrlSetPixelPrecision 2; // Enables pixel precision of the given control
ctrlSetPixelPrecision.description: Enable or disable pixel precision (rounding) in a given control interface.

vestItems.description: Get array with all items (of any kind, even weapons) from vest.

BIS_fnc_moduleEffectsEmitterCreator.description: /* File: fn_moduleEffectsEmitterCreator.sqf Description: Module function. Creates particle emitters and calls effect function. Parameter(s): _this select 0 (Object) - Module logic. _this select 1 (String) - Function name. _this select 2 (Number) - Optional - Number of emitters. Returned value: None. */

delete3DENEntities.description: Delete given entities in Eden Editor, including anything that can be placed in editor.

removePrimaryWeaponItem.description: Removes given weapon item from the primary weapon cargo space.

vectorWorldToModel.example: Convert world space vector [0,-10,4] to model space of object _airplane: _airplane vectorWorldToModel [0,-10,4];
vectorWorldToModel.description: Converts vector direction from world to model space.

BIS_fnc_ctrlFitToTextHeight.description: Resize structured text control to fit its text height.

toFixed.description: Converts a number into a string, keeping the specified number of decimals. If the desired number of decimals is higher than the actual number, nulls are added to create the desired decimal length. This command is almost identical in behaviour to JavaScript toFixed()

BIS_fnc_setMissionStatusSlot.syntax: [id, text, texture, color, fade, position, barHeight] call BIS_fnc_setMissionStatusSlot
BIS_fnc_setMissionStatusSlot.description: Set a slot for mission status with sectors, respawn tickets, etc.

BIS_fnc_unitAddon.description: Return addon from CfgPatches to which a given object belongs to.

BIS_fnc_enableSaving.description: Controls the enabling of saving. Will only enable saving if there are no remaining requests for disabled saving.

BIS_fnc_keyCode.description: Returns DIK code of a given key.

magazinesDetail.example: _magazinesDetail = magazinesDetail player; /* [ "6.5mm 30Rnd STANAG Mag(30/30)[id:3]", "6.5mm 30Rnd STANAG Mag(30/30)[id:9]", "9mm 16Rnd Mag(16/16)[id:12]", "Smoke Grenade (Green)(1/1)[id:14]", "Chemlight (Green)(1/1)[id:16]", "RGO Frag Grenade(1/1)[id:18]" ] */
magazinesDetail.description: Returns an array of strings with description of all vehicle's magazines, their ammo count (current/default) and their ids. When applied to a unit (soldier), the command behaves differently and will omit magazines already loaded into unit's weapons. Use currentMagazineDetail to get this information for a currently loaded magazine.

BIS_fnc_setDate.description: Instantly set date and share it across network.

lineIntersectsSurfaces.example: _intersections = lineIntersectsSurfaces [eyePos player, aimPos chopper, player, chopper, true, -1];
lineIntersectsSurfaces.syntax: lineIntersectsSurfaces [begPosASL, endPosASL, ignoreObj1, ignoreObj2, sortMode, maxResults, LOD1, LOD2, returnUnique]
lineIntersectsSurfaces.description: Returns list of intersections with surfaces from begPosASL to endPosASL. If there is ground intersection, it is also included. Works on units. Works underwater. Doesn't return intersection with sea surface. Hardcoded max distance: 5000m. By default, for speed purposes, command will return only 1st intersection with unique objects. Since Arma 3 v1.69.140138, this could be tweaked with an optional param. NOTE: if begPosASL is under the ground and endPosASL is above it, the command will only return intersection with the ground, this is engine limitation and none of the intersectXXX commands will work when initiated from under the ground.

removeWeaponTurret.description: Removes weapon from the turret. Use turret path [-1] for driver's turret.

addToRemainsCollector.description: Adds an array of vehicles/units to disposal manager for automatic wreck/body removal. The disposal manager follows wreck/body removal values set in description.ext

setShotParents.description: Sets vehicle and instigator pair for the given projectile.

flyInHeightASL.description: Sets the minimal ASL height. Final height is max(flyInHeight, flyInHeightASL).

BIS_fnc_markWaypoints.description: /* Description: Creates a marker on each uncompleted waypoint and marks it checked after completing that WP. Note: "On Activation" WP code is used for handling the markers; if this code is overwritten during the course, it can break this functionality Parameter(s): _this select 0: OBJECT - unit who will have its waypoints marked _this select 1 (Optional, use "" for default): STRING - text of hint shown after completing a waypoint, %1 is used for WP number (default "") _this select 2 (Optional, use [] for default): ARRAY of STRINGS - marker text format for [uncompleted, completed] waypoints, %1 is used for WP number (default ["%1", "%1"]) _this select 3 (Optional, use [] for default): ARRAY of STRINGS - marker icon for [uncompleted, completed] waypoints (default ["mil_circle", "mil_circle"]) _this select 4 (Optional, use [] for default): ARRAY of STRINGS - marker color for [uncompleted, completed] waypoints (default ["ColorRed", "ColorGreen"]) _this select 5 (Optional, use [] for default): ARRAY of NUMBERS - marker size for [uncompleted, completed] waypoints (default [0.75, 0.75]) Returns: NOTHING */

BIS_fnc_trimString.description: Get a substring out of the string.

BIS_fnc_endMission.description: Ends mission with a fade effect. See Debriefing for more information.

append.description: Appends array2 to the back of array1 modifying array1.

BIS_fnc_progressLoadingScreen.description: Progress scripted loading screen. The value will be preserved even when a new screen is opened.

BIS_fnc_initInspectable.example: [myLeaflet, "#(argb,8,8,3)color(1,0,1,1)", "This is some Magic Pink"] call BIS_fnc_initInspectable; // Initialize
BIS_fnc_initInspectable.description: Initialize inspectable object: add "Inspect" action to the object. When a player activates it, full-screen detail of the objects is shown.

addCuratorCameraArea.description: Adds or changes curator camera area (depends on if ID is already used).

BIS_fnc_setPPeffectTemplate.description: Apply post-process effects according to template from CfgPostprocessTemplates.

BIS_fnc_initVehicle.description: This function changes the textures, animation sources and/or mass of a given vehicle.

exportJIPMessages.description: Export list of JIP to a file.

BIS_fnc_markerToTrigger.description: Makes an existing or new marker cover a trigger area.

getAllOwnedMines.description: Gets all mine objects this unit has ownership over.

enableChannel.example: 0 enableChannel false; // Disable user ability to send voice and text on global channel
enableChannel.description: Enables/disables UI functionality which is responsible for sending text or voice chat to the given chat channel. If the channel was disabled in description.ext, it can be enabled with this command, however the UI functionality changes will be local to the PC executing this command. What this command cannot do:

BIS_fnc_playMusic.example: ["LeadTrack04_F",10,0.5] call BIS_fnc_playMusic; //Song starts at 10 seconds with 50% volume.

mineActive.description: Checks if the given mine is active.

nearestTerrainObjects.description: Returns a list of nearest terrain objects of the given types to the given position or object, within the specified distance. If more than one object is found they will be ordered according to 3D distance to the object (i.e. the closest one will be first in the array). In contrast to nearestObjects this command returns terrain placed objects like trees, rocks and buildings which don't necessarily need an associated config class.

BIS_fnc_netId.description: Extends MP-only netId functionality to SP

currentMagazineDetail.description: Returns description of vehicle's currently loaded magazine, its ammo count (current/default) and its id.

BIS_fnc_manageCuratorChallenges.description: Handle repeated curator challenges. When rewards defined in the argument are exceeded, refilling points bar fill be offered instead.

BIS_fnc_forceCuratorInterface.description: Force curator interface, so user cannot exit it by pressing Zeus key.

get3DENEntity.description: Returns Eden Entity based on its Eden ID. If the ID points to a layer or a comment, the ID will be returned instead.

BIS_fnc_diagKnownAsTarget.description: /* File: fn_diagKnownAsTarget.sqf Description: Visualize and profile which units know about one specific unit and how much they do. Calling function again stops diagnostics. Parameter(s): _this select 0: profile unit (Object) [default player] _this select 1: radius (Scalar - meters) [default 1000m] Returns: - */

forceFlagTexture.description: Forces a flag texture onto a flag carrier (unit, vehicle or flag pole). No flag holder is required. If "" is used as texture, the texture is removed. This will override regularly owned flags. This type of flag texture cannot be retrieved using flagTexture.

add3DENEventHandler.description: Add code to be run when a Eden Editor event is triggered.

BIS_fnc_getUnitInsignia.description: Get a unit's uniform insignia placed with BIS_fnc_setUnitInsignia

BIS_fnc_modulePunishment.description: /* Description: Make a unit play a punishment animation Parameter(s): http://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Modules Returns: NONE */ // Parameters

BIS_fnc_countdown.description: Triggers a countdown. Countdown can be accessed via missionNamespace variable bis_fnc_countdown_time

pixelW.description: Returns width of one pixel for current resolution.

humidity.description: Returns the current humidity value. 0 is no humidity and 1 is 100% humidity. Humidity value quickly changes from 0 to 1 when rain starts, then slowly changes from 1 to 0 when rain stops.

create3DENComposition.description: Create new Composition. To create individual entities, use create3DENEntity.

modelToWorldWorld.description: Converts position from object model space to world space (usable by setPosWorld for example).

BIS_fnc_addSupportLink.description: Adds support types during a mission.

BIS_fnc_locWeaponInfo.description: Shows a utility tool checking length of weapon info texts.

getArtilleryAmmo.example: if ("8Rnd_82mm_Mo_Flare_white" in getArtilleryAmmo [ _mortar1, _mortar2, _mortar3, _mortar4 ]) then { hint "Sir, we have white flares, sir!"; };
getArtilleryAmmo.description: Get list of all available magazines of artillery units on the list. Command returns only unique magazine types and doesn't contain any information about which unit has which magazine.

collect3DENHistory.example: collect3DENHistory { _logic = create3DENEntity ["Logic", "Logic", position player]; add3DENConnection ["Sync", [_logic], player ]; }; Creates a logic and connects it to player in one history step.
collect3DENHistory.description: Execute a block of code in which all Eden Editor operations will be recorded as one history step. For example creating an entity, setting its attributes and then connections would normally be recorded as three different steps. Calling them all within single collect3DENHistory block will group them together and the user will need to undo only once to revert the changes.

UAVControl.description: Returns array with current operator of UAV and his vehicle role in UAV.

getPilotCameraTarget.example: _pilotCamTrack = (getPilotCameraTarget vehicle player) select 0; _pilotCamTargetPos = (getPilotCameraTarget vehicle player) select 1; _pilotCamTarget = (getPilotCameraTarget vehicle player) select 2;
getPilotCameraTarget.description: Returns the target of the object airplane or helicopter pilotCamera tracking.

curatorEditableObjects.description: Returns all editable objects which belong to a curator.

currentMagazineTurret.description: Returns the name of the type of the currently using magazine on specified turret. Use turret path [-1] for driver's turret. Note that a turret is not loaded until unit enters it, so this command will return "".

tvDelete.description: Removes an item with given Tree View Path from Tree View. The paths of other items on the same branch are updated accordingly and may change.

BIS_fnc_loop.example: // hints time every five seconds ["itemAdd", ["uniqueId", { hint str time; }, 5]] call BIS_fnc_loop;
BIS_fnc_loop.description: Loop stacked code/function with timing and conditional control. Code and conditions are executed in non-scheduled environment.

BIS_fnc_liveFeedSetSource.description: Set the source of the current live feed.

removeItems.description: Removes all items with given template from the inventory.

squadParams.description: Returns data about squad of given unit loaded from squad.xml.

BIS_fnc_manageCuratorAddons.description: Set which vision modes curator can access.

BIS_fnc_exportMapToBiTXT.description: Returns terrain height map to BiTXT (Universal Bistudio TXT) format, which can be imported to Object Builder. Output is also copied to clipboard.

createMPCampaignDisplay.description: Create a MP campaign display. The class name must be a mission collection declared in the configs; in example, configFile/"CfgMissions"/"MPMissions"/"Apex"/

BIS_fnc_advHint.syntax: [classes, duration1, condition1, duration2, condition2, showing, onlyFullHint, onlyOnce, useSound] call BIS_fnc_advHint;

BIS_fnc_moduleEffectsPlankton.description: Creates underwater plankton effect around player (called usually by BIS_fnc_moduleEffectsEmitterCreator).

BIS_fnc_tasksUnit.description: Grab all tasks currently created for a given unit.

BIS_fnc_moduleTracers.description: Function used by the Tracers module.

speaker.description: Returns the speaker of a person.

BIS_fnc_findInPairs.description: /* Description: Searches the associative array for the 1st occurance of the key string and returns it's index. Syntax: _index:number = [_associativeArray:array,_key:string] call BIS_fnc_findInPairs; Example: 0 = [[["apple",3],["pear",2]],"apple"] call BIS_fnc_findInPairs; Returns: * if found: index (starting from 0) * if not found: -1 */

BIS_fnc_curatorObjectPlaced.description: Code executed when curator object is placed.

BIS_fnc_registerCuratorObject.description: Get individual cost of an object.

BIS_fnc_moduleWeather.description: /* Description: Set overcast and fog Parameter(s): 0: STRING - mode, can be one of following "enableDelay" - enable delayed activation (i.e., weather changes are not applied manually and have to be confirmed by mission) 1: BOOL - true to enbale, false to disable Returns: Nothing "isDelayEnabled" Returns: true if delayed activation is enabled, otherwise false "commit" - apply weather changes Returns: Nothing */

BIS_fnc_endLoadingScreen.example: ["myLoadingScreen", "Loading… wait for my splendid™ mission!"] call BIS_fnc_startLoadingScreen; uiSleep 3; "myLoadingScreen" call BIS_fnc_endLoadingScreen;
BIS_fnc_endLoadingScreen.description: Unregister a loading screen. When none other remains, end the loading.

isEqualTo.description: Performs strict comparison between var1 and var2 and returns true if equal, otherwise false. Strict means that it would check that both arguments are of the same data type and then compare the values.

nameSound.description: Returns the nameSound of a person.

setDetailMapBlendPars.description: Sets the detail texture map blend pars. Allows for smooth transition between detailed and undetailed terrain texture at distance. If noDetail > fullDetail, the texture detail will incur smooth transition in the area between the thresholds. If noDetail <= fullDetail there will be obvious visible edge between texture detail changes at fullDetail distance.

allCutLayers.description: Returns all named layers used by cutRsc, cutText, cutObj or cutFadeOut. The layer normally would be added on the first use of any of the aforementioned commands, however if a layer needs to be reserved it could be done like so:

set3DENObjectType.example: [ get3DENMouseOver select 1] set3DENObjectType "B_crew_F"; // turns object under cursor into a blufor crewman
set3DENObjectType.description: Sets the classname of one or more given Eden Editor objects. For Logic objects use set3DENLogicType

userInputDisabled.example: if (!userInputDisabled) then { disableUserInput true; } else { disableUserInput false; };
userInputDisabled.description: Returns true if user input is disabled

BIS_fnc_configExtremes.description: Scan config paths and return min and max values for each property.

BIS_fnc_limitSupport.description: Limits support runs during a mission.

animateSource.description: Process an animation of the object. If animate uses class name from CfgModels Animations, animateSource uses name defined by source property. This allows to use just one command on a bunch of animations related to the same source simultaneously. Since Arma 3 v1.65.138459 speed of animation can be altered with coefficient.

BIS_fnc_ORBATRemoveGroupOverlay.description: Unregister texture(s) to be displayed over CfgORBAT group.

BIS_fnc_initExpo.description: Disable parts of the main menu during public presentation. Press Ctrl+Shift+U to toggle the lock.

lockIdentity.description: Locks the identity of a person. This will disable default identity.

BIS_fnc_moduleSaveGame.description: Saves the game. Saving has to be enabled.

removeAllOwnedMines.description: Removes ownership of all owned mines/explosive devices of the given unit

BIS_fnc_removeFromPairs.description: /* Description: Removes an item from pair array. */

removeWeaponGlobal.description: Remove a weapon from a unit. An attempt to remove a weapon, which is not in unit's possession, is simply ignored.

lockCameraTo.description: Lock/Unlock stabilized camera (in vanilla used currently only for UAVs) to target.

BIS_fnc_liveFeedModuleEffects.description: /* Description: Add effects to a live feed via a module. Parameters: _this: OBJECT - Live Feed - Effects module */ // They ran me on a dedicated server. I stopped their function.

isTurnedOut.description: Returns true if given unit is turned out, otherwise false. The output changes to true after unit finished turning out, however will change to false almost immediately after unit is ordered to turn in.

BIS_fnc_interpolateWeather.description: /* Description: Interpolate weather (overcast and fog) according to 2 boundry dates and their weather conditions. Parameter(s): _this select 0: array - _date1 [_year1,_month1,_day1,_hour1,_min1] _this select 1: array - _weather1 [_overcast1,_fog1] _this select 2: array - _date2 [_year2,_month2,_day2,_hour2,_min2] _this select 3: array - _weather2 [_overcast2,_fog2] _this select 4: array - _subjectDate [_year,_month,_day,_hour,_min] (default: current date) Returns: [_interpolatedOvercast,_interpolatedFog] Example: [_overcast,_fog] = [[2035,1,5,24,00],[0.1,0.5],[2035,1,10,24,00],[0.3,0.2],[2035,1,7,24,00]] call BIS_fnc_interpolateWeather; */

remove3DENEventHandler.description: Removes Eden Editor event handler of given type and ID.

configHierarchy.description: Returns hierarchy of the given config class. Just like with inheritsFrom, only complete config classes are supported

BIS_fnc_liveFeedEffects.description: Add effect to the current live feed.

getClientStateNumber.description: Returns client state in network game. Works on both, client and dedicated server. The following states are possible:

getUnitLoadout.description: Returns a Unit Loadout Array with all assigned items, weapons, containers and their stored items. When String for class name is supplied, the command will search CfgVehicles for the given class in order to extract the loadout from config. If Config is given, it will search given config (including mission config) for the loadout information. In either case, the config should contain the following entries, which is standard for any unit class, for example:

moveInAny.description: Moves unit to the first available seat in a vehicle. The order of priorities is the same order used in squad command when you order subordinates to get in vehicle to any position and is the same order used in Zeus when you drag units to a vehicle.

getBurningValue.description: Returns amount of damage from fire.

isInstructorFigureEnabled.description: Returns the status of INSTRUCTOR FIGURE setting in UI (OPTIONS >> GAME >> GENERAL >> INSTRUCTOR FIGURE).

setMagazineTurretAmmo.description: Sets ammo count to given amount for given turret.

BIS_fnc_uniqueClasses.description: /* Description: Composes array of classes with unique param (based on returned value of passed code). If class inherits the param from parent, it's not listed. Parameter(s): 0: CONFIG - class which is searched 1: CODE - code executed on class, which is passed as _this Returns: ARRAY - classes in format [class,value] class: CONFIG - class with unique param value: ANY - value returned by the passed code for the given class */

animatePylon.description: Force animation of pylon to given state, -1 for reset to engine handling, can cause weapon inoperative, because weapon is released when pylon state =1.

addUniform.description: Create a new uniform and try to link it into uniform slot (given uniform has to be supported by allowedUniforms list of target soldier). To check if uniform is allowed use isUniformAllowed and to force add incompatible uniform use forceAddUniform

BIS_fnc_radialRed.description: Red radial postprocess (hit damage, fire damage). Parameters are the same as the first four of HandleDamage EH.

BIS_fnc_quotations.description: /* Description: Display a quotation video. Parameters: _this select 0: STRING - Path to quotation video file. _this select 1: STRING - String, localized or not, used for subtitles. */

savingEnabled.description: Check if saving the game is enabled.

setFromEditor.description: Set if given team member was inserted directly from editor.

setMarkerAlpha.description: Sets the marker alpha. The marker is modified on all computers in a network session.

viewDistance.example: hint ("my view distance is " + str viewDistance + " meters");

triggerActivation.description: Returns trigger activation in the form [by, type, repeating]. Note: The trigger could be local or remote but the result returned by this command will be for the trigger condition set up locally on the client that executed the command. See createTrigger for more info.

addMenu.description: Adds a new menu button. Priority is optional.

members.description: Return a list of members in given team.

dateToNumber.description: Convert a date to a float number, based on Jan 1st 00:00:00 = 0 and Dec 31st 23:59:59 = 1. The same day and time in leap year will be different after 28th of February and 23:59 on 31st of December will be 1.00274

hcSelected.description: Returns selected groups in high command.

BIS_fnc_listPlayers.description: Returns a list of currently played units, alive or dead.

getGroupIconParams.description: Returns group icons params used for command bar drawing such as color, text, scale, visibility, waypoint visibility, waypoint color.

setEditorMode.description: Sets map mode to MAP,3D or PREVIEW.

entities.description: Returns a list of all alive and dead entities of the given type or deriving from the given type. Units in vehicles are ignored. When empty string "" is passed for the type, all entity types are returned.

uiNamespace.description: Returns the global namespace attached to user interface.

showCommandingMenu.description: Create the commanding menu described by the given config class or menu name. When the name is empty, the current menu is hidden.

BIS_fnc_vectorAdd.description: Returns the sum of two vectors.

scriptName.description: Assign a user friendly name to the VM script this command is executed from. Once name is assigned, it cannot be changed.

isAutoHoverOn.description: Return true if vehicle has enabled auto hover. (always returns false if the vehicle can't set auto hover)

removeSimpleTask.description: Remove a simple task from the list of simple tasks.

BIS_fnc_returnVehicleTurrets.description: Return the path to all turrets and sub-turrets in a vehicle.

BIS_fnc_sceneGetPositionByAngle.description: /******************************************************************************* * * version: 1.0 * name: sceneGetPositionByAngle * description: returns new calculated position of object from angle and distance from specified object * parameters: described bellow * return value: array of new coordinates [x, y] *

removeDrawLinks.description: Remove all drawn links for the given editor object for the given editor,object type. Pass an empty string as param type to remove all draw,links for an object.

BIS_fnc_randomInt.description: Returns a random integer between the two passed numbers (inclusive). The order of parameters doesn't matter: it can be [min, max] or [max, min].

setPlayerRespawnTime.description: Sets the time interval (in seconds) that the player must wait before respawn. It resets to mission default on mission start. In Single Player or when respawn type is GROUP or SIDE in Multiplayer, setting player respawn time has no effect, and playerRespawnTime will always return -1.

createDiaryRecord.example: player createDiaryRecord ["Diary", ["Intel", "Enemy base is on grid <marker name='enemyBase'>161170</marker>"]]
createDiaryRecord.description: creates a diary entry. Supported tags and their parameters:

libraryDisclaimers.example: hint str libraryDisclaimers; // as in Arma2 OA 1.62.95208

BIS_fnc_arrayShift.example: _myArray = ["2", "report", "status"]; _removedElement = [_myArray] call BIS_fnc_arrayShift; // array is within an array _removedElement == "2"; // true _myArray isEqualTo ["report", "status"]; // true
BIS_fnc_arrayShift.description: This function removes the first (leftmost) element of an array and returns it.

lnbSize.description: Returns size of 2D listbox or combobox as [rows, columns].

surfaceNormal.description: Returns surface normal on given position.

BIS_fnc_nearestNum.description: Returns the provided set closest number to the target number.

setObjectArguments.description: Set object arguments in mission editor.

isAgent.description: Check if team member is an agent.

enableCamShake.description: Allows camera shake effects via addCamShake. If set to false, then a currently active shake effect will stop immediately. By default, shake effects are enabled, but once they have been disabled by this command, they will have to be enabled first, in order to be visible.

BIS_fnc_magnitudeSqr.description: Returns the square magnitude of an array of numbers. The vector can have any number of elements.

lockTurret.description: Lock the gunner position of the vehicle turret. This command must be executed where vehicle is local. This command will remove user get in action (not get out) but will also stop player getting into vehicle via script commands unlike lock command

execEditorScript.description: Execute an editor script for the specified object.

ppEffectCommitted.description: Check whether given post process effect is committed

ctrlMapCursor.description: Changes the default cursor that appears when interacting with a map control to a custom one. Use an empty string to restore the default cursor. If the specified cursor does not exist, the default is used and no error is produced. ( NOT in case of ArmA 3. Using an empty string will result in an error: "No entry 'bin\config.bin/CfgWrapperUI/Cursors.' ). The cursor is the name of a config entry from CfgWrapperUI / Cursors. This command has the following specifics:

disableTIEquipment.description: Disables TI (Thermal Imaging) equipment for given vehicle. In older versions of Arma this command would also disable NV (Night Vision), but since Arma 3 v1.52.132676 this command disables only TI. Use disableNVGEquipment to disable NV.
